33474886.review:
Shantae: Half Genie Hero is the latest installment of the Shantae series, after being successfully Kickstarted back in 2013 and easily surpassing its $400,000 goal. I believe they used this money well to improve the game both visually and audibly. I have not ever played Pirates Curse, and so this will not be a comparison between the two.

[h1]Positives:[/h1]

[b]Fantastic Visuals[/b]
Half Genie Hero got a serious visual update compared to other Shantae games, and it really pays off. With smooth 60 FPS animation, the game is stunning to behold and has detailed backgrounds often with many things going on in them as well (If you wait long enough in Mermaid Falls Factory, Bolo passes by on a hook with a fish attached to his head). This visual improvement ensures that people who are deterred from older pixelated graphics won't miss out on the classic Shantae character and platforming appeal.

[b]Catchy Music[/b]
While on the topic of visuals and audio, the soundtrack to Half Genie Hero is AMAZING, easily some of the best platforming music I've heard in ages. All of the tracks bring back memories of Sonic the Hedgehog and other 80s - 2000s platforming classics with that catchy beat and backing tunes. They all have their own unique appeal and their greatest strength is a lack of weakness. Even the worst of the music in the game is still good, while the best can get stuck in your head for days.

[b]Lack of Boring Dialogue[/b]
The characters may not have much in the way of dialogue variety, but what they do have is very good. Each conversation is full of personality, which may be further amplified if you have played all the previous Shantae games and already know all these characters. My only complaint is that there isn't much dialogue at all, most of the game is obviously focused on the platforming aspect.

Now, down to the real stuff. 
[b]Tight Gameplay[/b]
The gameplay is phenomenal. Shantae handles very well, as all Platformers should, and any damage I took was usually my own fault for not avoiding or predicting what I knew was already there. There are only a few jumps and sections where Shantae's handling comes into question, but these are small parts of the overall game and do not take away from the experience.

[b]Revisiting Areas is Actually Fun[/b]
Shantae plays sort of like an old Metroid game, where visiting old areas is highly encouraged. By gaining new transformations and abilities, whenever Shantae goes back to a level there is always something new to explore or unlock. This exploration is always rewarded with useful transformations and items (Except for the two useless crystal items, but I digress). For people who love to discover new secrets, this is definitely a plus. If you are not a big fan of constant back tracking, that's a shame, but the the incredible visuals and music may just make it more tolerable than you would think.

[b]Good Enemy Diversity[/b]
The enemies have a good diversity to them in the levels, and while many of them are similar (mechanically) all of them feel well-suited to the areas they belong in. Some enemies have unique traits and abilities that must be figured out first before defeating them, which is a good challenge to have during the rest of the gameplay. It doesn't suffer from "Mario Enemy Syndrome", where every enemy is only a threat by walking at you in a slightly different way. No one enemy feels unbalanced, ensuring that every area is enjoyable and unique.

[b]Bosses are an Enjoyable Spectacle[/b]
All the bosses in the game are a blast to fight, with their own mechanics and tricks to figure out much like some of the unique enemies. Each one presents its own challenge, and while some are easy others are fairly challenging to juggle around without the help of magic. Each boss was something to look forward to at the end of a level, like the topping on a cake.

[h1]Negatives[/h1]
Unfortunately, as will all games, Shantae is not all flowers and butterflies. It has its own share of problems.

[b]Way Too Easy:[/b]
The base game in Half Genie Hero is easy with even moderate platforming skill. Enemies are predictable (As are most platformer enemies) and can be killed easily with practice. This is made so easy to the point of being almost impossible to die with the use of magic and the Magic Tiara, which can turn you invincible, do massive damage, and cheese the final escape section. However, those seeking a challenge can attempt Hard Core Mode, which gives a massive boost to enemy damage, attack speed, adds more mobs, and boosts boss AI. Hard Core Mode is a good challenge, albiet a little TOO challenging at time. But what do you expect? It's called Hard Core Mode, not Slightly Harder Mode.

[b]Massive Difficulty Spike in the Final Level[/b]
The final level of Half Genie Hero ramps the difficulty up tenfold, and it cannot be reduced through spells like most other areas can. There is a flying section that requires precise control of the Harpy transformation, which at the best of times handles like a hyperactive dog on roller skates. This is followed by an escape level with very questionable hitboxes on vital handholds, leading to potentially numerous frustrating deaths. This final escape can be easily cheesed by using magic, however. All I can really say is to hang in there and do your best!

[b]Underwhelming Final Boss[/b]
While I won't spoil it for those that care, the final boss is possibly the easiest boss in the game, made even easier if you found the Harpy Talon item while backtracking. It's not a deal breaker, but it makes the ending slightly less satisfying than it could have been. This one is a minor gripe, the boss is still fun to fight.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
All in all, while it has its negatives, Shantae: Half Genie Hero is certainly worth the buy. There is even more DLC on the horizon, with Risky Boots herself being playable with a full campagin in the near future. It's worth the full price, and especially worth it if on sale.

For a person who abhors playing platformers on a PC, I not only found this game incredibly fun with good music (the kind that doesn't annoy you after an hour and a half trying to going after an achievement) but easy to control. Everything except the harpy controlled really smoothly, and the harpy is designed to be kind of a challenge, so that's acceptable. I had alot of fun messing around with the various dances, discovering magic lets you float in midair, and fighting the bosses, who I found unique and very challenging. But most impressive to me is how Wayforward managed to take 5 explorable worlds and transform them into places you can go back to time and time again to discover new things.
This game is fantastic and I would recommend it to anybody who enjoys platformers, or to people who don't. This game has convinced me to try more platformers, as well as solidifying my support for Wayforward Technologies.

33346430.review:
2017サマーセールでシリーズ初購入、クリアしてのレビューになります。
次のような方にこそお勧めです。
[list]－「アクション系は苦手だけれど、興味はある」[/list]
[list]－「普段メトロイドヴァニアやプラットフォームゲームをやらない」[/list]

「Ori and the Blind Forest」を全力でコミカル＆KAWAII＆カジュアルにした感じでした。

[b]「良い点」[/b]
[list]－アクション系が苦手な方でもクリアできる難易度[/list]
[list]－最新ハード（XboxOne）に対応したHD化[/list]
[list]－KAWAII[/list]

[b]「悪い点」[/b]
[list]－このタイプに慣れていると簡単すぎ＆短いと感じる[/list]
[list]－（このゲーム内の）難関アクションステージを踏破しても達成感が無い[/list]
[list]－日本語対応ですが一部翻訳が変（元の英語のノリのせいもある）[/list]
[list]－風呂屋のヒントは役立たず[/list]


コミュニティガイドにアクション系初心者の参考になるものがなかったのと
友人も詰まっていたので、いくつか助言を。
※この後、ちょっと長くなります

[h1]「落ち着いて観察を」[/h1]
このタイプのゲームはいわゆる「死に覚え」系になります。
同じ個所で何回かミスしても、怒らずに笑い飛ばしましょう。
「初見殺し」（かなりゆるいですが）なので、
　・この箇所はどうすれば先に進めるか？
ステージ内のギミックを観察して、手持ちのダンスで可能なアクションと相談してみましょう。
リスタートは高速ですし、リスタート地点の書き換えも短いです。

[h1]「タッセル・タウン」[/h1]
恐らくアクション系が苦手な方が詰まってしまう最初の難関でしょう。
Oriを知っている方には「ギンソウ樹の脱出（の超簡単なやつ）」と言えば通じるでしょう。
とはいえ、ゲームの性質上攻略動画を見てしまったのでは面白さ激減です。
ポイントになるところだけ。
　[b]・Steam正式対応のゲームパッド推奨（Xboxコン、最低でもPS4コン）[/b]
　　鎖をジャンプで渡る箇所などが特にそうなのですが
　　方向を斜めに入れておく必要があります。
　　キーボードや方向キーだと正しく斜めに入っておらず
　　　一本目の鎖からジャンプ→二本目の鎖に掴まる（ここで斜めなら自動で掴まってくれる）
　　これが失敗します。
　　時間制限があるステージはここくらいですが、これは的確にできるようになりましょう。
　[b]・途中のノコギリや敵は無視してかまいません[/b]
　　HPが減っているようなら、迷わず回復アイテムを使用すれば問題ありません。
　[b]・途中の隠し要素っぽいものは無視しましょう[/b]
　　後で取りに来るものです。（最初は絶対に取れない）
　　登りきる事を優先しましょう。

[h1]「マルチエンディングについて」[/h1]
一応、マルチエンディングです。誤差ですが。
実績コンプリートに興味が無い方は
[spoiler]「リスキィのアジト」に行く前＆おじさんにリスキィの手がかりを４つ渡す前[/spoiler]のデータを複製して保存しておくとよいでしょう。

33250710.review:
The Shantae series has always been a great platformer / metroidvania. The maps are well designed and fun to explore. And the feature which sets this game apart are the belly dances you aquire throughout the game which allow you to transform into adorable critters which give you unique abilities to navagate and access certain parts of the map. The writing is always fantastic, the dialogue between characters often has you laughing out loud as they always have quirky conversations.

Half-Genie Hero sees the series enter the HD generation. The 2D character art is gorgeously drawn and the levels are rendered in 3D which blend in seamlessly. The music is absolutely steller with each track fitting its respective level perfectly and are a joy to listen to. The game is also more of a reboot, so if you did not play the other games you will not be missing anything as there isn't a whole lot referencing the previous games.

All said and done, Shantae: Half-Genie Hero is a must play game. The series has always been one of my faves, and as somone who likes to attempt 100% completion without any help I got over 20+ hours of gameplay on my first blind playthrough not including any DLC. And if you are someone who wants a game to fly through, the game has the speed run element which awards you an achievement for beating the game in only a few hours, so this game is accomodating to multiple play styles.

33199023.review:
If you're familiar with the previous Shantae games, you'll definitely feel right at home with this one.

It's basically Shantae's first big screen experience. All the familiar characters are back, including a few new ones to keep the story fresh. The gameplay is back to basic; with the transformations being the main focus of travelling through the different levels to find hidden items or NPCs you need to talk to. Need I mention, the soundtrack is as great as ever! I find myself tapping Jake Kaufman's slick beats every time I hear the different themes of the levels and even some of the characters themes. The bosses are huge in scale this time, almost covering the entire screen. Overall, the game is pretty quirky its in character interractions/dialogues and man-- gotta love those vibrant colors!

The only downsides I can point out are the amount of backtracking you have to do, considering there's only a handful of levels. Normally, I don't backtracking an issue in Metroidvania-styled games, but the levels are way too short to have any sort of backtracking, only to find NPCs you need to talk so that they can give you an item to progress the story further. If the levels were bigger, I would've forgiven it, but I personally find it very tedious to go back to the same levels over and over again just to make sure you haven't missed a single thing. About the transformations; like I said, the level structure relies too much on them. It's much easier to travel once you obtained all of Shantae's transformations, but then again, it feels very tacky having to transform every second just to be able to land on that one platform you normally can't reach.

On a side note, it's not much of a criticism, but I just find it funny that the game is aware that their audience is very "niche". There always been hints of innuendos in the character dialogues or how the girl characters are skimpily dressed. It's easy for feminists to tear appart how the game portrays the women. But I think it's not worth judging a simple yet fun game like this that doesn't really offend anybody. It is what it is and I think it's great to have more female leads in gaming.

Alright, I'm done rambling for now. I definitely recommend giving a try this short and sweet game that I'm sure you'll enjoy, especially if you're craving for more Metroidvania-styled games... and with a kickass soundtrack on top of that!

33180024.review:
Alright, I've to say, this game is dope.

The artstyle is unique and amazing, It really gives the Donkey Kong Country Returns vibes with the 3D backgrounds and creative design.

However, unlike DKCR, there aren't many levels. only 6 or 7, but the gameplay is longer due to forced backtracking in older levels. But that's kinda my thing as I like to explore more of the part in the same level, especially if I liked the level as well. 
The warp dance and wistle does help a lot to clear up too much unnecesary backtracking. Enough to also keep the exploration part.Which is really a relief for me sometimes.

Story is a bit simple. It kinda reminded me of 'Totally Spies', Where you were doing normal things but were also interrupted by a mission to save the country. (Also with lotsa girls.)  It's not really deep, but good enough to enjoy it.

As far as fanservice goes, there are a lot of monster girls and a lot of monster girls transformation. All pretty unique, but a bit disappointing that you need the transformation only for one specific task. And sometimes they're only able to do that task and nothing else, not even attack. (although some of these can attack later, as upgrades to progress). It would be nice if there were less transformations but able to do more functions. A bit like Zelda: Majora's Mask. But maybe that a bit too much for a platformer.'

In comparison to the 'visual novel' appearance the game had in their 'Pirate's curse' installment, the game has gone a more unique way, and they don't cover half of the screen with a girl in a bra anymore. The picture is now smaller and more cornered, but it's still showing the same amount of body. It's in my view fitting for both the Visual Novel fans and for the people that aren't bothered by it. And I find that a good step.

I think the only real issue I had is that the game seems to run slower on my laptop, there are little-to-none quality settings. So if your PC is bad, then I cannot recommend it.

Overall, I'm really enjoying the game. The art, music and characters are amazing. Although the backtracking might have been a little too much in the earliest stages. But I really don't mind it as the game is really appealing. Compared with 'some' of the nightmare fuel the previous game had, I found this one much more bearable to enjoy too.

A bit of the same statement as the previous game: 
If you're looking for clever level design and difficulity, I think this game is too easy and backtracking.
If you're looking for great character design, level art designs and soundtrack (and monster girls). This is a game for you.

33112866.review:
GLANCE RECOMMENDATION: [u][b]90% YES[/b][/u] / 10% NO
 
[h1]GOOD[/h1]
[list]
[*]Gorgeous art and stunning characters. There's so much life and charm in this game when just looking at it. I loved getting every new form and checking out crouch and idle animations. The character designs are hands down my favorite
[*]All combat feels great. The movement and hair whipping feels real solid.
[*]The transformations are a great addition to the game and give me a lot of options in terms of mobility, evading, and damage.
[*]Exploration is rewarded often and it's easy to remember where untackled loot hides when you finally unlock the ability. The exemplary thing is that all of the locked off content is easy to recall, like all those flowers you kept seeing everywhere.
[*]Level variety is superb. Everytime someone mentioned I go somewhere for an item, I immediately knew which level it was in.
[*]Boss designs are slightly simplistic, but are fun and different enough where you might adopt transformations in between combat to leverage their strengths per boss.
[*]The game is as difficult as you want to make it. You don't HAVE to collect the extra heart containers and you can easily turn off any obtained equipment / powerups (e.g. armor, infinite magic). I love the player choice in this. It also helps that there is a hardcore mode for those yearning for more.
[*]Music has a kick & step to it that made me love strolling around Shantae's home land.
[/list]
 
[h1]NEUTRAL[/h1]
[list]
[*]There are a few frustrating segments, like the tower climb and the spiky corridor in final level (until you learn not to use the harpy for that but the monkey bullet hint hint), but nothing really takes more than a few tries to master. Nothing was insurmountably hard given the content.
[*]I wish there were more reasons to use some of the transformations. I honestly think there is only one area you need to use the spider form in at all and one other occasion for an achievement, which bummed me out. 
[/list]
 
[h1]SUMMARY[/h1]
An incredible entry in the Shantae series featuring exploration, animal transformations, and some of my favorite character designs of the series. An absolute delight I'd gladly recommend at full price.

32906255.review:
First things first, the music and visuals in this game are fantastic, my issues with this game lie 100% in the gameplay.

In this game, unlike previous shantae games, the levels are treated like sonic style stages split into different acts, rather than the more metroidvania style zones in past shantae games. This wouldn't necessarily be a bad thing, as new transformations make replaying levels legitimately interesting at first, but as you play more, the pace of the game starts really falling apart.

You gain new transformations after beating the boss of each level, so you're immediately unable to explore your new abilities unless you replay old levels, which you are forced to do because after every level you are handed a fetch quest to get the macguffin to lead to the next level. This gets old very quickly, especially when you have to go back to levels that you've already replayed once before, the warp dance and the whistle only speed this up so much. This gets more extreme when you find that your transformations aren't enough, and it's only after exploring for a while that you find an upgrade for your transformation to help you finish the fetch quest. Exploring on your own is also not very rewarding, because often you either run into a wall where you need a future transformation you don't have yet, or all you've managed to do is find a future macguffin before you were told to. This makes progression feel slow and awkward and ultimately nowhere near as fulfilling as past shantae games.

One other nitpick, the pacing in levels is sometimes off too, for example lazers, spikes, and pits won't just damage you, but also teleport you back to the start of a stage, so puzzles full of this obstacles don't just damage you, but also revert so much progress that getting back gets legitimately frustrating. I think if this issue alone was solved, the game overall might be much less frustrating to play through.

Overall, if you want to get this game to experience the music and art, and are willing to bear with the poor pacing in gameplay, then go ahead. If not, you might want to pass this one up.

32846426.review:
Красиво, но слишком мало.
Игра хорошая. Красивая графика, очень хорошее музыкальное споровождение, которое хочется скачать и слушать отдельно. Есть много красивых персонажей. Есть так же различные перевоплащения самой Шанте. Лично сам игру прошел с удовольствием. 

Но есть у игры не менее серьёзные минусы. Мало уровней в игре: их всего 6 и они сами по себе довольно короткие. Как следствие мало, где можно приминить все перевоплащения Шанте. Вся игра строится на повторном прохождении этих уровней в поисках квестовых предметов, что быстро надоедает. С одной стороны повторные прохождения это интересно, но не когда из 6 уровней ты реально 4 постоянно перепроходишь и уже изучил каждый уголок, и как следствие вся игра проходится слишком быстро. Очень сильно игре не хватает больших уровней и побольше. Так же сюжет в игре слабоват и сильно провисает в некоторых местах. Отдельно следует сказать о сложности: игра очень легкая. Игре катастрофически не хватает уровней, которые бы усложнялись бы по мере прохождения. Режим хардкор не использовал, ибо неинтересно заного одно и тоже проходить только с посильнее мобами. Официально русского языка в игре нет, но в интернете есть русик от зогов. 

В целом игру советую купить, так как денег стоит не больших и несколько приятных впечатлений всё же игра способна доставить, так что ставлю игре палец в верх. Многое уже в основном сказал в обзоре Зерглинг, только лишь не соглашусь с красным пальцем, ибо несмотря на все серьёзные недостатки игру купить стоит.

un platform molto, molto carino in stile metroidvania. La protagonista è Shantae, un genio della lampada - per metà - il cui compito principale è di proteggere la sua città (e già che c'è, aiutare anche lo zio nella costruzione dei suoi marchingegni). Il gioco si presenta subito con una marcata e ben riuscita componente umoristica, mentre parte integrante del gameplay sono le varie trasformazioni con cui Shantae potrà mutare il suo aspetto e i suoi poteri. Ad esempio, la scimmietta può arrampicarsi sui muri, la sirena nuotare sott'acqua, il pipistrello volare in orizzontale, etc
Nonostante non sia un fan di questo genere di giochi, devo dire che invece Shantae: Hal-Genie Hero lo consiglio caldamente. E' divertente, piacevole da giocare, difficile il giusto e con un'ottima grafica e colonna sonora.

32755108.review:
(Note: Even though I only got about a half-hour on the PC version, I completed the game on the Wii U.)
Shantae is back and just as good as she was before! Though is this a definitive version to play? Let's get Ret-2-Go!
Story: In a dream, Shantae saw herself go into a cave underneath (or she thinks) Uncle Mimic's house. A voice explains that she's their only hope to the one that'll doom them all. The next morning, after getting a sneak peak of the Dynamo, Risky starts her attack immediately after a Tinkerbat stole the Dynamo Blueprints! As far as story goes, it's pretty simplistic by its accord and there are a lot of movie-quality cliches in this game. 7.5/10
Controls: Very much like Pirate's Curse, this relies on the arrow keys and zxcasd for the main controls. Still plays pretty solidly even on a keyboard, but it still pays to have a controller on hand. Back is the "dreaded" dancing and it's incorporated in a way similar to Risky's Revenge, though it was supposed to be like the original game's dancing mechanic in that enemies can interrupt you. Each creature plays relatively unique from one another and they control pretty great. 8.5/10
Graphics: Out with the pixel-work and in with the chibi Flash style! To be fair, the graphics are still great even if they're relatively old, the characters still are themselves, the levels have their feel and beauty, and it's not hard to understand why they wanted to use this style in contrast to the pixelart style. 9/10
Sound: Music and Audio go here. As per usual, Jake Kaufman has done fantastic work in his music, and really, my only complaint has to be that he had to add in an electric guitar riff in an otherwise mostly techno-inspired music. (9.5/10) As well, there are more voice lines in the game, though those do vary in quality and volume, especially near the beginning. And as usual, the sounds connected to objects are still satisfying enough that it's a pleasure to continue. (8/10) Overall: 8.8/10
Overall and mentions: This game, while good, is also close to unforgivingbly short, with side-quests placed in to make this otherwise short game feel much longer. However, while I do say that, I argue that it works in its own accord, especially when we have time sinks like Skyrim and Fallout in the area. The bosses are satisfactory enough, and it's challenging, though not impossible to get all the keys to the local Art Gallery. This game will get an 8.5/10, since while this game is not THE best of the Shantae series, it's far from being the worst, hell, every Shantae game is at or above an 8/10 for me and should get a little more attention, just not so much Capcom buys it out and whores it out. Otherwise, this is SoupCanMafia, age 20 and this is the badly drawn review.

Algunas palabras se han traducido de manera literal (ejemplo, "grunt" lo tradujeron como "gruñido", en vez de "secuaz" o "recluta"), otras no tienen sentido ("throwing shade" lo ponen como "vomitando sombra", en vez de "hablando mal" o "insultando").
La verdad, me esperaba un mejor trabajo de traducción por parte de Wayforward (o de la empresa subcontratada, qué sé yo), sobre todo al ser un proyecto financiado en Kickstarter. En Pirate's Curse la traducción es buena pero, ¿por qué en este título fue bastante mediocre?
En fin, el juego es bueno, pero la traducción no tanto.

32660841.review:
This is the first Shantae I played to completion. I've played a little bit of Risky's Revenge but otherwise I was going into this blind. It's a very short game, six levels in total with some goodies to find in each one. However, I do remember that two of those levels were Kickstarter stretch goals. DLC. So that would put the main game at four levels discounting those two "episodes" that may be part of the main progression but honestly they just come out of nowhere in the storyline without any semblance of transition and once they're wrapped up that's it no one mentions them again. Story was nothing to write home about either. It's your standard Goody Two Shoes vs Supreme Badness black and white plot. Shantae learns of a great threat to the Genie Realm, promptly forgets as she helps her uncle build a machine, does some other hero stuff, then oh no Genie Realm is now in danger because the villain is trying to destroy everything for some unexplained reason.

I found all the collectibles in this game, explored all the hidden areas, found all the dances, spells, items, etc. A big issue though is that the forms are either useless or only needed for one or two areas in the game then shove them in the box. There's 16 total dances (there's a damn BLOBFISH dance that does nothing) and you make use of three or four on a regular basis, mostly Monkey. There's also two that break the game open completely: Bat and Harpy. Bat lets you move horizontally as long as you don't have any obstacle. Harpy is free flight. In a platforming game this pretty much lets you cheese entire levels with some creative positioning.

My playtime clocked in at a little over 7 hours and I was taking my time. For a $20 game, though I did Kickstart it. This is a very, very, VERY short game and I honestly cannot recommend it at this price point. It doesn't feel cohesive in gameplay, story, or anything really. I'm actually disappointed I backed it. Supposedly it will eventually have a story where you play through as Risky Boots and others but they're not in yet so, what you see is what you get.

32638315.review:
if you've never played a shantae game, this is a good starter into the series, and the story, while typical, is easy to follow. controls are pretty natural, game is overall very cute and at times impressive-looking, and the music is very catchy, as is to be expected of Jake Kaufman. this game brings back the classic transformation-based shantae play, and contains an *absurd* amount of them, including some special dances bought from a snake lady and a few promotional ones if you backed the game on kickstarter (hopefully if you didn't you at least also didn't back mighty no. 9...) 

though the story lacks a bit and only serves to *raise more* questions than answer any presented in the past few titles in the series, it still stands as a great game in a great series. in general, a very solid game, and if you liked the pirate gear play style of pirate's curse, then there's also a DLC on the way where you play as risky boots!

32620703.review:
Итак, я уже чувствую, как в меня целятся все, кому не лень. Поэтому и не только поэтому скажу: да, это хороший платформер, в него реально стоит поиграть, но везде есть одно "но". И это "но" я попытаюсь объяснить и пояснить.

Если вы не играли в предыдушую часть, то советую в нее поигроать. Именно с Pirates Curse  я и буду срапвнивать эту игру. Начнем:

Сюжет

Мне кажется или основной сюжет очень сильно порезали: в начале оставили, да в конце им приправили. Все остальное - это работа девушки на побегушках - тем помоги, тут дело мутится, и все в таком духе. Возникает такое чувство, что разработчикам надо было просто создать парочку офигительных историй, чтобы занять наше время, пока дядя клепает машину. Это меня удивило: впринципе что мешало создать единый сюжет, который происходил бы, пока дядя клепал машину? Вроде бы и почва есть и персонажей умеем создавать. Видимо, что-то пошло не так. Еще сильнее волнует недостаток новых персонажей: какой-то там еще один полуджинн, которого мы, вряд ли, увидем в следующих частях и посланник, который появляется два раза: в начале и в конце. И, к сожалению, о старых то мы особо ничего нового и не узнаем. Обидно, однако, когда в прошлой части разработчики создали практически целую фракцию, какую-то историю, связанную напрямую с джиннами, с прошлым и пустоту нынешней.

Геймплей и все, что с ним связано:

Само же управление довольно просто и удобно, что радует. Однако все скиллы, которыми нас так щедро угощают делвют игровой процесс максимально простым. Иногда даже удивляешься такому обилию различных трансформаций, когда нету абсолютно никаких достойных уровней, для их использования. То есть все они нужны только для поиска спрятанных предметов. Все эти трансформации в остальном - это просто способ сэкономить время, если вы спидраните. не более того. А вся магия - это просто... дикая имба:. Чего стоит заклинание, которое дает полную неуязвимость или спец танец для фарма денег из магии. Но даже и это еще не все. Большинство этих навыков присутствовало в предыдущих играх. Тут только сделали пару трансформаций, которые по сути лишь урезааные части какой-то из старых или трансформация типа "то же самое, но под другим углом", т.е ползали по стенам - теперь ползаем по потолку, но в другой форме. Серьезно, даже абилки некоторых трансформаций те же оставили, что и в прошлых частях, например "Обезьянья пуля" из Risky Revenge.

Квесты.

Что радовало в прошлых частях - не было так много ключевых предметов, за которыми надо было возвращаться для продолжения игры. Но тут видимо решили исправиться - квесты, квесты и еще раз квесты. " Сходи, найди в заднице уровня чувака, он даст тебе предмет, потом принеси его другому чуваку, он даст другой предмет и потом принеси это дяде" вот и вся суть этих квестов. Иногда думаешь " Ну зачем они все тут?" И слава богу, если вы запомнили секретные места, но ведь тут даже нет банальной карты, как в прошлых частях. И прикиньте, вот идете вы по уровню и думаете: " Да бл*ть, где ж я еще не был то?" Весьма сомнительное развлечение.

Подытожим все, что я там понаписал и за что вы меня закопаете при первом возможном случае:

Такое чувство, что у разработчиков кончилась фантазия для придумывания сюжета. Видно же, как они пытались хоть чем-нибудь занять игрока, пока наконец-то не начнется самое интересное. Еще больше меня удивило выход платного дополнения для тех, кто своевременно не купил игру. Для остальных, естественно, бесплатное. Причем то, что там я увидел - это все есть в самой игре без всяких там допов. Ну это пока что трейлер, так что особо нету смысла об этом базарить.

А теперь к хорошему. Плюсы:

Музыка и саундтрек:
Как обычно на высоте. Особенно понравился трек в начале игры. Браво, Шанти, я не думал, что ты поешь, жаль, что, видимо, авторские права (Лол) помешали послушать чуть подольше ваш голос.

Графика:
Полное HD, за что можно похвалить. Анимации, текстуры, прорисовка миров, персонажей: в этом, слава богу, не подкачали.

Возможность менять сложность:

Очень не хватало такой функции. порой кажется, что все слишком легко, да и сам хардкор вносит баланс в эту слишком уж легкую игру.

Впринципе все. Была бы оценка "нормал" поставил бы ее. А так вышло на порядок хуже предыдущий части, поэтому и красный палец.

32157097.review:
I finally managed to complete this game, so it's high time I did the review!

[b]Pros:[/b]
[list]
[*] great, albeit simple gameplay - it's a mix between simple platformer and metroidvania.
[*] gorgeous, hand drawn art style - I really love the art direction of the game - graphic designers did a great job. I also really enjoyed watching unlocked concept arts - for ex they gave nice insight into crab form creation.
[*] cheerful, light hearted atmosphere and music. I enjoyed the soundtrack - while it's not revolutionary, it does the job well. Not much more to expand about this point - the game is cartoony and there isn't any unexpected violence or dark turns. 
[*] many fun and good looking transformations - while the transformations aren't groundbreaking in terms of metroidvania, they suit most of stages' designs well.
[*] It's kickstarter done right! Not always one can say it about a game, expecially when certain [i]mighty[/i] disappointments are happening.
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
[*] Game is too short. It doesn't have too many stages, and in addition a penultimate one feels rushed and poorly designed.
[*] Boss fights are underwhelming - I like when in metroidvanias bosses require creative use of acquired powers in order to break their guard. In this game fights are barebones and simplistic.
[*] Game is relatively easy, even on hard mode. It's still a fun challenge, but it's definitely not a game for players that like to be seriously challenged skill-wise by a game.
[/list]

If I had to give number score for it, it would be [b]7.5/10[/b] - I feel I can't give an honest 8 to it, mostly because of the lazy penultimate stage. It feels like all creative power was spent on the previous stages and the final one. With that being said, I still recommend this game! I had a lot of fun with it and I think it's worth buying and playing, especially if it happens to be discounted!

32144066.review: This game is so much fun to play that my words can't even describe it! I didn't even know that the game was based on Turkish culture until i looked really close.

32108673.review:
Over the last couple of years, the Shantae-games have become one of my favorite 2D-plattformer games. Not only did they make great use of the Metroidvania-style gameplay, but they also had very charming and memorable characters, interesting oriental-themed levels and great music. Half-Genie Hero is no exception here, I had a blast from beginning to end.
One of the problems of the older games was that the animal-transformations, one of Shantae's signature moves, take way too long and therefore hurt the pacing of the game. That problem has been totally fixed here, so playing through each of the very well designed levels feels totally fluid.
I was a bit worried about the new graphic-style of the game, but after playing it for a while, it became totally natural to the point where it was actually hard to go back to the older games with their pixel-graphic. The soundtrack is also amazing, there's a lot of catchy tunes that fit the theme of the levels perfectly.
However, there's still a few minor things I didn't enjoy. Firstly, the game got rid of any dungeons, which makes each level feel much more linear. Secondly, the story felt very disconnected. Each level basically had a mini-arc, but they weren't really connected in any way so the overall arc felt way too basic and undeveloped. And thirdly, there's really not a lot of levels here, namely 6 in total. And 2 out of these 6 levels were only included because certain Kickstarter-stretchgoals were met, which means the game was originally planned to only have 4 levels. Granted, all these levels are very big and you visit them multiple times to unlock new areas, but still. I hope the upcoming DLC will expand these levels in some way.
Despite all these minor gripes, I still had a lot of fun with the game, and I can encourage everyone to try it. All the Shantae-games are underrated gems that should really get more love.

32045099.review:
The belly-dancing half-genie hero has been around since the Game Boy Color, but it's only in recent years that she has gained the recognition that she deserves, and it's good that she finally has, because the Shantae games are a treasure chest (this analogy would perhaps be better suited for this game's pirate-themed predecessor, Shantae and the Pirate's Curse, but still) for platformer enthusiasts. And this newest entry to the series is no exception. 

Shantae: Half-Genie Hero is a great game in many aspects. The visuals are stunning. The vibrant colors and the cartoony art style really brings the world of Shantae to life, as you explore the variety of areas that Shantae must traverse on her quest, from a waterfall inhabited by mermaids, to the ruins of a desert town and a spooky old castle. 
The soundtrack also contributes to bringing the world of Shantae to life, with a bunch of funky and catchy tunes (with a hint of Middle-Eastern inspiration here and there) that wouldn't be out of place in old-school Mega Man or Sonic the Hedgehog games. 
Speaking of retro 2D platformers, the gameplay of the Shantae series as a whole can be described as a sort of hybrid of Mega Man and Metroidvania-style games.  This particular entry however is much more Mega Man than Metroidvania, eschewing the dungeons and largely open 2D world in favor of action stages, where you start at one end and finish on the other.

Manuevering through each level while beating up any bad guys along the way is the name of the game here. To help her combat the fiendish foes she'll encounter, Shantae can either do her good old hair whipping (I wonder what kind of shampoo and/or conditioner she uses to get her hair that strong), or use magic abilities like fireballs or summoning flying scimitars or thunder clouds. Transformations have made their comeback, being absent in Shantae and the Pirate's Curse, and are used to help traverse the world. Need to climb a wall? Transform into a monkey and do some acrobatics. Need to break down a wall? Transform into an elephant and smash your way through. Need to go for a swim? Transform into a crab or mermaid and dive in. Some areas of each level can't be accessed until you acquire transformations found later in the game, so you have to re-visist each level at least a couple of times to find all the items and achieve 100% completion (and at few points, also to progress the story). 

My only real complaint about Shantae: Half-Genie Hero is that I wish it were longer. Yeah, you can unlock "Hero Mode", in which you have all of Shantae's main transformations available from the start, which is a great boon to speedrunners, and  
there's "Hardcore Mode", which as the name suggests, increases the difficulty. These two do give the game some replay value. I just wish the main adventure wasn't as short, that there were more areas to explore and such. . 

All in all, Shantae: Half-Genie Hero is not a game that revolutionizes the platformer genre, but it doesn't need to. For what it is, it's a ton of fun, and I can warmly recommend it to anyone who's into that genre of games. 

Pros
- Fun gameplay
- Amazing soundtrack
- Beautiful visuals 

Cons
- A bit on the short side. Would have benefitted from being more Metroidvania-ish like its predecessors. 
- Re-visiting certain levels can be a bit tedious at times

I could explain why I'm not recommending this game despite the great visuals, evident polish, and amazing music. But I won't, because that means I'd have to go back to the beginning. Of the stage. AGAIN.

Unlike the three previous games before it, this game has wild spikes in difficulty yet is incredibly easy overall. It's a test in frustration because you know you're going to keep dying to this one BS instakill part you're stuck on even though you have way too much money and healing items to compensate. And the fucking backtracking, goddamn. I like metroidvanias and platformers! But why do I need to do probably five straight tasks in a highly specific order? Some of the clues given by townsfolk will make you go to one stage again just to see if one new thingamajig is there (and most of the time its very small), sometimes the thing you want to get is something you can't get yet because oh no you have to go to THIS level first to get THIS levels item, even though nothing the townsfolk said points you where to go FIRST, and that doesn't help when there are only five levels! So much wasted time. So you'll be playing the same five levels over and over, not counting the times you're playing a level you shouldn't be. The funding amount on the Kickstarter and puddle depth this game has shows when you combine the two factors. WayForward generally does a decent job, but they put all their effort into visuals first this time around.

4/10

I originally downloaded this game as a meme to pass the time while waiting for something else to download. Turns out I liked this game way more and it even made me go and buy the previous installment "Shantae and the Pirates Curse" as well

Pros:
-Fun, satisfying combat
-Genuinely likeable characters and funny dialogue
-Excellent HD Graphics
-All the levels and enemies associated with them are unique, no reskin & repeat mobs
-With the upcoming DLC, you can play as Risky Boots, the main antagonist as well as all of Shantae's friends
-Plenty of collectibles to keep you busy, there's always something you need to do and you rarely, if ever, get lost
-Several combat options ranging from Shantae's signature hair whip, to powerful magic spells
-The transformations are all really cool, even the bat has it's uses especially if you're speed running
-Absolute god-tier soundtrack

Cons:
-The game is short, like, 6-9 hours short
-You have to backtrack frequently to previous levels after acquiring new abilities in order to get stuff you couldn't before 

Things You Need To Decide For Yourself Whether Or Not They Are Pros Or Cons:
-Unless you play Hardcore mode, the game is pretty easy and healing items are abundant
-There's a near end game item that gives you infinite magic which you can pair with an invincibility spell and become literally unkillable
-Similar to The Pirate's Curse, there's a somewhat large jump in difficulty between the rest of the game and the final platforming level.
-Some people complained about backer exclusive kickstarter rewards, however I personally found that they weren't that special and missing out on them doesn't detract from the game in the slightest
-All you miss out on are two color palette swaps, one for Shantae and one for Risky, a sword reskin for Risky Boots, and the tinker bat transformation, which honestly, isn't all that useful

Verdict?
Great, low stress game with good replay value, entertaining characters and interactions as well as fun combat. 9/10 would recommend

Great game, improves on a lot of aspects of the Shantae series, and doesn't overstay it's welcome. Unfortunately the amount of backtracking is just a bit too much, especially when it is tied to VERY specific transformations that are largely useless in other scenarios. It isn't perfect, but it is a wonderfully fun game to just turn on and play.

pros

cons

 game could have similar length and greater depth by combining usage of multiple powers in puzzles and removing

31485150.review:
Ayant joué aux précédents volets sur console portable, je me suis lancé sur celui-ci qui fut le premier véritable de la saga à être réalisé pour les supports haute définition, les précédents ayant été des portages. Si dans l'ensemble, j'ai apprécié ce jeu, il risquera cependant de souffrir d'une inévitable comparaison avec ses prédécesseurs.

L'histoire du jeu reste en toute somme classique : la suite "pas tout à fait" directe de "The Pirate's Curse", Shantae devra faire face à une nouvelle menace sur son monde, mais aussi sur le royaume des génies, et dont elle seule est capable de sauver. Cela nous amènera à retrouver quelques personnages phares, mais aussi des nouveaux présentant un rôle influençant le déroulement du jeu. A noter que ce dernier, en évitant de dévoiler son contenu, possède deux fins : il faudra remplir certaines conditions afin de les obtenir.
Par ailleurs, si vous disposez de connaissances assez limitées dans la langue anglaise, je vous conseille de passer votre chemin : la traduction française réalisée est d'une qualité plus que douteuse. Avec un choix de mots inapproprié et une lecture parfois incompréhensible des dialogues ("Back to your old tricks" changé en "De retour à tes vieilles astuces" ?), vous passerez certainement plus de temps à vous creuser les méninges qu'à suivre l'histoire et comprendre son humour pourtant très présent, celui-ci étant bourré de jeux de mots amusants et de références plutôt réservées à un public âgé (notamment lors de la première rencontre avec Risky Boots).

Les graphismes restent superbes et dans le style du jeu. L'ajout de textures 3D est ici une nouveauté, puisque les précédents étaient intégralement sur un plan. S'ils ont en déroutés plus d'un, ce ne fut pas mon cas : j'ai même trouvé que ça permettait de renouveler le style qui était globalement resté le même entre "Risky's Revenge" et "The Pirate's Curse", à l'exception de celui des personnages dans les cinématiques. J'ai par contre des réserves sur ce dernier point, où l'aspect "oriental" originel de la série eut, j'ai l'impression, tendance à se rapprocher davantage de celui "manga".

La bande-son est également dans le thème du jeu, avec quelques morceaux tirés des anciens volets et remixés pour l'occasion, et s'accorde parfaitement à chaque situation et environnement dans lesquels nous nous situons. Le choix de n'inclure que quelques phrases parlées dans les dialogues ne m'a pas gêné en soi : cela permet d'éviter de trop se concentrer sur la narration, et de laisser au joueur le rythme qu'il souhaite avoir. Si je trouve la chanson phare de ce volet très sympathique ("Dance Through The Danger"), je regrette cependant son intégration dans le jeu, qui vient casser l'ambiance qui a toujours été jusqu'alors instrumentale.

En termes de jouabilité, le jeu reste proche des précédents volets : il s'agira de déplacer le personnage de Shantae, la faire interagir avec les autres personnages et de se servir de ses cheveux comme "arme principale". Vous devrez parcourir des niveaux et affronter des boss, pour pouvoir obtenir de nouvelles transformations et progresser dans votre partie. Le principe de la transformation a d'ailleurs évolué : au lieu de réaliser certains pas de danse, nous devons seulement appuyer sur le bouton adéquat, puis par le biais d'un écran de sélection, choisir celle que nous souhaitons. C'est un changement qui n'est pas forcément gênant, mais qui réduit la quantité d'animations proposée auparavant.

Si l'environnement du jeu se construisait autrefois comme une carte géante où l'on pouvait se déplacer librement pour atteindre ses objectifs, les niveaux présents dans le jeu sont cette fois-ci conçus de façon plus courte et de façon linéaire : nous avons un point de départ, et devons atteindre une arrivée. Cela permettra à certains joueurs de moins se perdre en les parcourant, mais aussi de les terminer plus rapidement. De plus, le jeu vous proposera des items vous permettant de naviguer dans les zones sans avoir à les parcourir, le rendant du coup plus simple, et accessible au public le moins patient. Comme pour les volets précédents, une fois que vous avez affronté un boss, il vous sera impossible de l'affronter une deuxième fois. Il aurait été bien d'avoir un mode supplémentaire, genre une fois le jeu terminé, où l'on puisse de nouveau affronter le boss de son choix.
Si vous avez joué à l'un des précédents volets, et aviez jugé les différents allers-retours longs et répétitifs, attendez-vous à les voir revenir ici : il vous sera nécessaire de revenir dans certains niveaux pour récupérer des items inaccessibles tant que vous n'avez pas acquis certaines transformations. Si jamais vous séchez, les personnages dans la ville de "Scuttle Town" vous seront d'une grande aide (parfois un peu trop ?) pour avancer dans votre partie.

Concernant la durée de vie, le jeu ne propose, pour son mode principal, qu'une difficulté unique et assez peu élevée, le mode "Hardcore" ajouté récemment étant d'un tout autre niveau (j'ai décroché au bout de 8%). L'ayant terminé en 8-9 heures à 100% (avec tous les items à trouver et à acheter), soit un poil plus court que "The Pirate's Curse", le jeu pourra vous proposer ensuite un mode Héro reprenant l'histoire du jeu et certaines des transformations acquises durant la partie : la difficulté étant cependant la même, je ne saurais vous le conseiller, sauf si vous appréciez faire des speedruns. D'autres modes de jeu ont été annoncés dans de futurs DLCs, et pourront très certainement augmenter le potentiel que le jeu dispose déjà en matière de gameplay.

Au final, je pense que ce jeu mérite le coup d'oeil, mais s'adressera d'abord aux fans de la première heure. Sachant qu'il ne possède pas de liens directs avec "The Pirate's Curse", et constitue en soi une nouvelle histoire, il sera tout à fait possible pour une personne n'ayant jamais joué à l'un des volets précédents de commencer avec celui-ci, ce que je déconseille fortement puisque la saga "Shantae" possède son univers, où chaque jeu la composant apporte son lot d'innovations avec la période durant laquelle il est sorti. Tout le monde n'y trouvera bien sûr pas son compte, mais je sais en tout cas dans quel camp me situer.

31457831.review:
Maybe one day steam will add a "neutral review" option for us.

Now is this game good? Absolutely, but you know what else is good? Pirate's curse and compared to that game, half-genie hero Is a pretty big downgrade. Quickly stating the positive, the gameplay is still relatively nice, the writing is still dumb in a good way and the new visuals are beautiful. After that it's just a downhill slide, mostly because after the pirate equipment in pirate's curse this game returns to the animal transformations. (Spoilers: they still suck) not only are the transformations slower and pace breaking compared to the pirate equipment they're also useless for the most part. Apart from the Harpy, mermaid, monkey and maybe the elephant the transformations are either trophy fodder or just plain worthless and it feels so boring and sluggish when you have to constantly alter between different forms. The game also has the usual problem of unnecessary backtracking which is an issue in every game in the series but in here it's worse. The game is also pretty damn easy and you can quickly get pretty OP items, only for the game to give you a large difficulty spike in the final level because that's fun. And the final boss...jeez. the pirate master was an amazing final boss and was very challenging. This games final boss is a joke if anything, just like every other boss in this game. 
Now I'll say this again, half-genie hero is a good game. Nothing special but I enjoyed it a little bit. It's better than the first game and Risky's revenge (not saying that's exactly impressive) but Pirate's curse is pretty much the only truly great game in the series. If you want the best Shantae experience, I definitely recommend pirate's curse for you.

But even with 60 fps the game stutters horribly. It fluently runs 1-2 seconds, then has a massive stutter of 0,2s or something and then runs well for a few seconds again 

My setup: Windows 10, i5 3570k, GTX 1080, newest drivers

I tried: 
[list]

    [*]Disabling my secondary screen
    [*]Running the game on my 60 hz TV
    [*]Launching the x64 dx11 exec
    [*]Running it in administrator mode
    [*]Disabling high DPI Scaling
    [*]Leaving all the video (driver) settings up to the game

    [*]Enabling/Disabling Vsync ingame and in the nvidia cp - Which doesn't do anything
    [*]Disabling steam overlay
    [*]Killing all other apps on the pc
    [*]Launching it in Big Picture Mode
[/list]

Nothing fixed the stuttering.

Looking at the discussions with posts about these problems from back in December 2016 the Dev apparently doesn't care too much about this... Really bad port to PC. Do not buy this in its current state.

steam上的第一份评价，也是第一份好评，就给shantae吧（普通难度100%）

既然是第一份评价，那自然就要写长点

·人物：一方面，本作的人物在制作和绘画上比前作要更为细致，
换句话说，就是变得更萌啦（相信不少人已经将第二关的人鱼女王囊括在自己的老婆圈里了吧），
而身为主角的shantae更是不必多说，从蹲下时猫一样的蓄势待发，到跑太过时的一个踉跄，
再到变身后的各种可爱形态（我个人比较喜欢蜘蛛和人鱼形态），虽说本作语音很少，
但这些一举一动都会让你不由地相信这就是那个活泼可爱的半精灵英雄；
然而另一方面，由于篇幅较短，本作对其中的不少人物的刻画都不够到位，
这就导致了一些人物咋看上去很萌，但到了结尾连个深刻印象都没留下的情况，
（我是挺希望第三关的橙毛能成为shantae的姬友的），而且，
虽说身为主角的shantae的动作很丰富，但其他人就不是了，像我们那位僵尸妹子，
从头到尾一直在扭屁股。。。

·剧情：像我之前说的，本作的篇幅较短，而且剧情一般，总而言之就是save the day啦

·音乐： 本作的音乐相当带感！每关的音乐都是不同的， 而且每首曲子都相当出色！即便你在玩的时候什么都不做单听音乐， 那也是一种享受吖~

·难度：本作难度不高（普通难度），但要注意的是如果你在一个场景死了就得从头开始了，
而且，难度到最后一关会突然增高，要做好心理准备

·游戏性：本作的可收集品很多，并且它们的隐藏位置也相当巧妙，在收集物品的过程中能获得不少乐趣，
但另一方面，本作在攻击动作和种类上比前作少了不少，boss战也较为简单（其实本作真正难点在躲避障碍物上=w=）,
100%完成后我就没多少动力再通一遍了（而且在打完最终boss后你再进存档它只会让你回到最终战之前==），
如果是单纯为游戏性入的话请再三考虑

虽说本作存在一些缺点，但总的来说还是相当不错的，希望这个系列能越做越好！

PS:在网上经过长时间搜寻的后，我发现沙漠塔里有首曲子貌似是没有收录进OST的（OST好像是出了众筹的钱才能得的，大家还是在网上找吧）那首曲子明明是相当好听的吖。。。。

31327099.review:
The latest, and second-best, entry into the Shantae series. A competent platformer full of fun characters, humor, and music along with an absolutely adorable art style, I can definitely recommend Half-Genie Hero, along with the rest of the series... especially Pirate's Curse.

The gameplay is a level-based platformer with some seemingly token Metroidvania aspects, but continues the Shantae series's trend of moving away from a "true" Metroidvania style. Instead of complex levels as seen in previous titles, levels are now standard left-to-right platforming stages where you move through 2-3 areas and end with a boss. Metroidvania aspects come in when you have to repeat levels with new lock-and-key transformations (and unlockable powers for them) to find 'hidden' areas to collect collectibles for various NPCs or new abilities. This leads to the gameplay "loop" of doing a few new levels, getting to a plot roadblock, and backtracking to solve it.

The world of Shantae does, however, make up its merely good-but-not-great gameplay. It's hard to not have fun in the colorful world filled with its genuinely likeable characters, humor, and music. As a entry-point into the series, you meet most, if not all, of the series's cast of characters and the humor isn't too reliant on referential in-jokes.

Perhaps the most disappointing thing I can say about the game was the fact it was a Kickstarter game with more ideas than they hit stretch goals for, and it shows. Some characters are introduced and summarily dealt with in an incredibly unsatisfying manner, especially with a late-game *lack* of boss battle that can only be truly described as a "blue ballsing most foul" when it's presented and solved in the span of one cutscene.

In the end, I can still recommend Half-Genie Hero and would recommend you try Pirate's Curse if you enjoy the world, which is the best part of every game in the series.

楽しかった！
Shantaeの過去作はやっていませんが、紹介動画や評価の高さからセールを待って買ってみました。
過去作からの人間関係はわかりませんが、ストーリー上困ることは全くなかったです。
私はゲームは息抜きにちょこっとやるくらいの下手くそですがとても楽しめました。
ちょっとジャンプの動きが大きくて最初の頃は扱いづらかったですが、コントロール性そのものは良いです。
強化する道具や魔法で下手でもごり押しができたりします。道具や魔法を買うためのお金も比較的簡単に貯まるので序盤でも強化しやすいです。
ステージもそれほど難しいところはありませんが、強制滑り台と下から追われる塔は何度も死にました。あと最終ステージのトゲトゲの間をとんでいくのは辛かった。最後の脱出は初見のバイオ４を思い出しました。なんでラスボス倒したのに私死んでしまうん？こういうのやめてもらえませんかね。自分の下手さが情けなくなるので。
ラスボス前にアイテムコンプリートしましたが、隠し通路などもそこまで難しくはないので自力で集められました。
クリアしたステージもアイテム回収で再度探索することになるのですが、新しいダンスを覚えたりすることで楽に動き回れたりするので、それほど苦にならないようになっています。
ただマリオみたいにステージ毎のマップとかにしてくれたら、アイテム回収がしやすかったかなと思いますね。
日本語が怪しいところも多々ありますが、こまけぇことはいいんだよ。かわいいは正義。

とにかく良ゲーム。おすすめします。

30912867.review:
I was given a Steam Review Copy of Shantae: Half-Genie Hero by WayForward themselves, so I felt obligated to finish this game and review it.

Note that this is the first time I'm actually trying to review something for realz, so I'm as unproffesional as you can get. LOL

At the time of this review, I only finished the Shantae Main Mode on Steam.

ABOUT:
Shantae embarks on her first full HD adventure! When a mysterious crime wave sweeps Sequin Land, it’s up to Half-Genie Hero Shantae to save the day! Use Shantae’s devastating Hair-Whip Attack to send monsters flying, or Belly Dance to transform her into more powerful forms! Topple the masterminds behind each criminal caper and prepare for the ultimate showdown against Shantae’s arch nemesis - the bodacious buccaneer Risky Boots!

VISUAL:
The visuals are strikingly beautiful and the animations are amazingly smooth! No one can shake their booty as smoothly as Shantae can! EVERYTHING is so beautifully designed, I actually tried to Google Image search to see if there's any other side scroller games that can even match this game visually. There are none. Seriously, the way this game look, it can make Nintendo jealous.

Even though it looks visually nice, I'm surprised by how much they lack fanservices. Shantae games are known to be very fanservice-y.

I really wish the KickStarter reach the Animated Cutscenes stretch goal. It would've been really amazing seeing all these wonderful to see and hear characters act, rather than them standing around and talking in text boxes.

AUDIO:
Aside from Dance Through The Danger (https://youtu.be/71lLnE8gJnU) which is an absolutely amazing song by the awesome Cristina Vee, the other soundtracks range from catchy to just okay. They range from what sounds like an elevator music, to something that sounds like it belongs in the first level of a current gen Donkey Kong game, and service their purpose really well. You'll be able to recognize where those tracks are from, but they not good enough to get stuck in your head for hours.

Due to not reaching the specific stretch goal, the game isn't fully voice acted. Like Shantae And The Pirate's Curse, only a handful of lines are voice acted, and most of them belong to Shantae and Riskyboots. It's actually quite sad, really. All those quietness could've been filled with Cristina Vee's amazing voice-acting.

GAMEPLAY:
A 2D side-scroller game where you use various magic and items to help you solve puzzels and find hiddle treasures.

There's also a couple of fast-travel features that help the player travel from area to another with relative ease. It was a welcomed innovation for the series because helps so much with the back-tracking, and you get them very early and very easily! Screw collecting warp squids! Give me the Bird Whistle and the Warp Dance!

There's a couple of magic/items felt like they exist for only like one or two uses, and they won't be used ever again. They're almost pointless.

DIFFICULTY:
Out of all the Shantae games, this is easily the easiest one of the bunch. Unlike other Shantae games, it very forgiving. I only used like 3 potions through the entire game, and it was because I ran out of Magic, not Health. This caused me to max out the amount of gems I can carry, after purchasing every item in game, at around the half-way point. But it's not to say that this game is completely easy. The last area can really make you rage if you haven't mastered all of Shantae's animal forms.

GAMEPLAY LENGTH:
It took me around almost 12 hours to complete the Shantae Main Mode with 100% Completion, and that includes the times I spent revisiting areas and looked all over the places for hidden treasures to achieve 100% Completion. It'd be a lot shorter if it was a speed run.

There's also Shantae Hero Mode that unlocks after playing Shantae Main Mode, and possibly a Riskyboots Mode that I haven't unlock yet.

The player can also replay the game as Rottytops, Bolo or Sky in their own storyline!
So yeah, lots of gameplay value in this game.

VERDICT
Shantae: Half-Genie Hero is actually a really good and fun game. Yes, it does feel like it is lacking a few things that could've make it perfect, but I honestly can't blame WayForward for that since those missing things are the stretch goals that they never reach. Their KickStarter campaign was up around the same time as Mighty No. 9, and most people either just support MN9 only, and/or being really hateful towards Shantae for some reason, maybe because they're being pro-MN9 at the time. For what Shantae: Half-Genie Hero turned out to be with what WayForward got from crowdfunding, unlike Comcept, WayForward delivered in spades, and for only USD19.99 too! I can say that it's better than Shovel Knight, I highly recommend this game to anyone!

30884378.review:
Игра классная, рекомендую всем фанатам платформеров и Шанти. Отлицная графика, анимация. Шанти теперь ещё и поёт, а не только танцует. Главную тему "Dance Through the Danger" исполнила Кристина Ви, актриса озвучивющая Шанти.
Вот вобщем то и все, о игре и так многое написано

Я в свою очеред хотел немного поразмышлять о всей серии целиком. Это чисто моё ИМХО.

Во-первую очередь в глаза бросается легкось игры, враги не требую особых тактик. Не нужна элементальная магия, просто жми быстрее кнопку атаки. При повторном прохождении уровня прокачаным персонажем можно просто бежать на пролом, кастанув на себя какую нибудь ауру (влоть до полного имуна). Боссы довольно простые. Однако в последнем уровне в каждой игре сложность возрастает в разы. Даже начинает подгорать. Особенно в "Pirate's Curse", последний уровень не уступает по сложности "The Angry Video Game Nerd Adventures". В этой части также, но тут проходя последние уровни я заметил, что мне начинает нравится такая сложность, но не настолько сложные. Прохождения препятствий начало доставлять удовольствие. 
Почему бы не сделать всю игру такой, это конечно повлечет за собой полную переработку механики уровней и секретов. 
которые собственно "Во-вторых".

Во-вторых многие секреты не обязательны для прохождения игры. К тому же, они разбросаны так, что их можно найти только методом тыка. Просто обшаривая каждый уголок уровня по нескольку раз. 

Вот тут вступает повышение сложности. Тагда уже не погуляешь фривольно по уровням и лишний раз обыскать закуток станет проблемой, тут и нужна система подсказок, намеков. И нормальная карта. 
Лутинка найденая случайно доставляет намного меньше удовлетворения, чем та которую нашёл разгадав подсказки.

В итоге, что бы я хотел увидеть: повышение сложности, вменяемая карта, логичексие подсказки по поиску предметов, врагов с разными слабостями (магия, мили, огонь, лед и тд)

30591197.review:
Эта игра великолепна буквально во всём. Графика приятная и красочная, музыка замечательная, управление отзывчивое, сложность не слишком высокая, но и не совсем уж казуальная, а сюжет при всей своей простоте интересен. Диалоги отлично прописаны и сдобрены хорошей порцией юмора, хотя читать их моментами сложно из-за слэнга (текст написан так, будто некоторые персонажи говорят с акцентом или просто разговорный английский с его сокращениями вроде dunno и 'round). 

Кому хочется сложности, можете сразу начинать на "Hard Core". Враги станут толще, урона станете получать больше и всё такое. Ачивки заставят попотеть и пройти игру не один раз. Кстати я где-то видел отзывы критиков что сложность в некоторых моментах завышена, но по-моему у этих критиков просто кривые руки. Нормально тут всё со сложностью, в всё в пределах разумного и идёт она по нарастающей.

Единственный странный момент это озвучка. Персонажи как правило произносят первые пару слов из предложения, а потом замолкают. При этом голосом говорят не все и не всегда. Во время диалога может быть по 10 фраз от каждого из двух персонажей, но озвучены только две из них у одного из персонажей и, как я уже сказал, только первые пару слов из них. Это не минус, просто очень странно. Предыдущие части по-моему вообще не разговаривали голосом и всё было нормально.

Плюс в этой игре полно женщин, чем серия никогда не брезговала кстати. Тут с сиськами все, от самой Шанте до бабы-змеи которая продаёт вам магию. 

И ко всему этому великолепию вроде как должны DLC завезти, где можно будет за других героев поиграть.

Однозначно рекомендую! WayForward как всегда молодцы!

P.S. Рейтинги metacritics как всегда барахло и не соответствуют действительности.

30481309.review:
If you're looking for a deep story, great levels and a big world, this is not your game. Half-Genie Hero has more in common with Megaman than it does with its previous entries in the Shantae Series, while trying to hold to its original roots, and somewhat failing at it. 

Where HGH succeeds the most at is in its fidelity. This game is really colourful, the animations are bouncy and lively, it's just very pleasant to look at. The soundtrack is really good too, however, I do find it to sound REALLY flat due to its really high volume. After downloading several soundtracks from the composer, Jake Kaufman, that seems to be an ongoing issue with his masterings. So if the game sounds too loud when you first start it up, it might catch you off guard and I defnitely recommend lowering your volume.

When it comes to being a sequel, the game improves a few things from it's closer sibling, Risky's Revenge, is the dancing system and overall powerups. The new system implemented in this one works better as you only have to press the dance button and then choose which transformation you want by pressing a direction. It works well and if you think it's too slow, you can even get a powerup to make the dance faster. In fact, HGH is probably the fastest feeling entry so far thanks to its responsiveness.

Probably my personal favorite part of the game when it comes to gameplay are the first four stages... when played linearly. They are quick, action-packed and are quite fun to traverse with fun bosses (Except for the last two...).

The first part where game falls apart to me when they want you to backtrack to stages to get specific items. It wouldn't be a huge issue if the stages introduced new things but they just don't. The ''new paths'' are usually one or two rooms, which more often than not, will either be coursed through in less than a minute, or are big and open with nothing in them, just to pad things out. It gets really monotous to since you have to do exactly that, several times in a row to even progress to the next stage.

The second part is actualy the final third of the game. The stages feel unfinished, with even less original set pieces, hazards, especially when two key characters are haphazardly placed in the second to last stage, with no introduction. In fact, a lot of characters in HGH are completely forgetable and have barely to no development at all and when the game ends, it really feels unsatisfying. Now if you factor the rather dull design, and combine what is essentially the game breaking transformation, the Harpie, you get a final stage that is insultingly easy. Why? The stage was designed for you to take advantage of a couple of transformations. The Issue? The harpy can fly over the majority of them. There were only two counts where I switched to the monkey. This makes some rather elaborate traps completely useless.

The final boss and endings are not much better. First, my game crashed once when I defeated the first phase of the boss. Second, I skipped the cutscene as the fade to black was still on the screen, leaving it black and making the fight impossible (I've encountered several glitches so far, some worse than others). Third, if I am either regular Shantae, Mermaid Shantae or Harpie Shantae, the background of the second phase will never rotate like it should and screw with the movement of the boss' attacks. FOURTH, the final phase has an attack that circles the whole arena, and it makes no sound effects. If it does, I can't hear it. It also blends with all the other assets during the fight due to their colours. FIFTH, the endings are almost identical, regardless if you get the ''best'' or ''regular'' ending. It's  just not satisfying at all and feels slapped together.

The final slap in the face to me from this game, is the fact the DLC will have to be paid for non-backers. Considering how barebones the game felt, along with the lackluster two final stages AND the full price of this game, I flatout cannot consider even getting the DLC. I feel like they should have been part of the game ''and the price'' from the very start.

If Shantae Half Genie Hero was not forcing mandatory exploration and padding and was more like Megaman, as its stages are clearly focused on being much more linear than the areas from the previous entries of the series, this would be so much better. However, as it stands, and WITHOUT THE DLC AND AT FULL price. I can't really recommend this game unless you're a die hard fan. If you want a significantly better experience, go get Shantae and The Pirate's Curse.

If the DLC releases and they have a bundle for the launch price of the game and cut the standalone game's price, then it might be worth checking out. Maybe....

30404964.review:
En resumen: [b]COMPRALO[/b]

Esta es la cuarta entrega de la saga de juegos Shantae, que existe gracias a una campaña de crowfunding en Kickstarter. Dando el salto al mundo HD, Shantae se enfrenta a una nueva aventura para detener a Risky Boots una vez más, del dominio del mundo.

Como es característico de esta saga, es un Metroidvania, es decir, plataformeo con eliminación de enemigos y rejugabilidad de niveles asegurada gracias a las nuevas habilidades y movimientos que vas obteniendo a lo largo del juego, lo cual va haciendo el juego muy entretenido y te fomenta e incita a investigar los niveles, lo cual conseguían los otros y lo cual en mi propio caso es muy bueno por que no he sido nunca, NUNCA de rebuscar objetos en los niveles, y aquí estoy que me lo he pasado al 100% por que, entre la investigación y búsqueda en los niveles es primero divertida y segundo, gracias al movimiento que responde a la perfección, y un diseño de niveles que es perfecto, hace que la jugabilidad sea algo muy disfrutable en este juego y muy satisfactoria. También es menester comentar que gráficamente es un juego, precioso, animaciones muy bonitas y vivas, y el sountrack, como viene siendo costumbre ya, viene a cargo de Jake "no se cuantas veces voy a decir esto pero te comía las bolas" Kaufman, que hace que este soundtrack sea genial y me vaya a llevar tarareando y canturreando las canciones y temas de este juego durante meses. Y por cierto joder que bonita es Dance Through the Danger coño la primera vez que la escuché me eché a llorar como un poseso de lo bonita que es.

Ahora, en comparación con las antiguas entregas, el nivel de dificultad, al menos en el modo normal, jugando como Shantae pelada y mondada, es considerablemente bajo en comparación. No te resultará dificil llegar a cierto punto en el que estarás muy roto y en vez de pasarte los niveles parece que le haces bullying a los niveles de lo roto que vas lo cual, es algo un poquito triste sinceramente. Pero justo hace tres días a fecha de 9 de marzo de 2017, los desarrolladores lanzaron la primera actualización a este título con, aparte de bugfixing, introdujeron un poquito más de contenido, es decir, el modo Hardcore. En pocas palabras, cuando empiezas el modo Hardcore, entran ocho negros en bolas con bates de béisbol de pinchos en tu habitación y la mitad te violan y la otra mitad de apalean, haciendo turnos entre los que apalean y violan. [b]Es el desafío que este juego necesitaba, Y ME ENCANTA.[/b] Vaya, en el primer nivel me quedé afónico de lo que me estaba cagando en todo, por que en comparación al modo normal que el primer nivel es un paseo, en el modo Hardcore puedes tranquilamente morir unas 15-20 veces si estás acostumbrado a jugar a este juego ya, que yo ya me he pasado dos veces este juego, así que, si eres nuevo en esta saga y nunca has jugado, y te gustan los desafíos bien complicados, te recomiendo que empieces directamente al modo Hardcore, junto a un té o cualquier bebida relajante y una pelotita de estrés.

Pero, es necesario que comente esto. Este juego está completamente traducido al español, junto a una serie de idiomas más. Si sabes inglés y no quieres que los ojos te lloren, por favor, en tu biblioteca, ve a las propiedades de este juego y en la pestaña Idioma, ponlo en Inglés. La traducción al español que tiene este juego es [b]INACEPTABLE[/b]. Hay una infinidad de faltas ortográficas, de errores a la hora de referise al sexo de otro personaje, de incoherencia en las frases, de todo. Es un puto desastre de traducción. En los créditos aparece que las traducciones corrían a cargo de una empresa llamada DYS. Pues qué quieres que te diga, pero yo, he cogido y he descomprimido el archivo pak de localización, he cogido una linea de texto en inglés, me he ido a puto Google Translate, lo he pegado, y ha salido exactamente lo mismo. WayFoward, tío, os la han pegado esos tíos, [b]que tenéis un juego lanzado con traducciones de Google Translate[/b], que os devuelvan el dinero de todos los patrocinadores y que os han donado dinero. Mirad, os hago una oferta: me propongo a traducir este juego. Gratis. No quiero un puto duro. Solo quiero que este juego tenga la traducción al español que se [b]MERECE[/b]. Lo hago por amor al arte y por amor a la saga. En serio.

En resumidas cuentas a to este tocho: es un juegazo, jugabilidad excelente, si queréis un desafío lanzáos al modo Hardcore y si sois unos casuals po id con el modo normal y si sabes inglés y quieres enterarte de algo de la historia cámbiale el idioma a Inglés en Steam por que hasta lo que cago es mejor que la traducción al español de este juego. Compradlo.

30367798.review:
[h1][b] Как описать игру так, чтобы в ней передались собственные ощущения? [/b][/h1]

[b]Говоря о предисловии вкратце:[/b] первая понравившаяся игра в [b]2017[/b] году; первая игра, на которую я пишу обзор в этом же году; первый платформер, купленный мной в этом году...
Немного покопавшись в интернете, Ютуб представил предо мной красивую картинку и бодрый геймплей. Под сомнениями решил забить её в стиме, и...   Она мне понравилась. Купил с радостью, но все же думал, что игра не окупится...
Но она окупилась, и теперь я в полной мере могу представить сие творение...



[b]Шантае: Героиня Полуджинни[/b] - это платформер переживший переход с пиксельной рисовки на HD формат, который прошел весьма успешно. Так как я не знаком с прошлыми частями Шантае, я могу сказать что результат отличный: игра засияла новыми красками, улучшена анимация (Ну прям глаз не оторвать от ее танца) и прочие прелести эволюции...

[b]Главной особенностью игры[/b] является интересная система превращений. Допустим, вам нужно взобраться на уступ, но в обычной форме вы этого не сделаете, ведь он высок. Вы превращаетесь в форму обезьянки (обычно это именуется танцами), и залезаете на ранее недоступный вам уступ. Если ползать по потолкам не обезьянья стихия, здесь вам на помощь форма паучихи, гордо передвигающаяся по потолкам...

[b]Система взаимодействия[/b] сделана не пусто, она обязывает игрока распрашивать NPC для получения полезной информации, помогающей находить определенные сюжетные предметы, формы, все те же тайники.

[b]Если о сюжете[/b] - мне понравилось, я считаю что он сделан вполне на уровне, хотя рутина все же присутствует: Найди там, спаси тех, принеси мне то, и тогда это заработает.
[b]О сложности игры[/b] - игра в начале может понаставить хлопот, так как умираете вы легко. Но найдя тайники со здоровьем, купив предметы в магазине, вы буквально будете бессмертны. Боссы не трудны, хотя к некоторым нужен определенный подход.
[b]Но еще вот что - [u]она не реиграбельна.[/u][/b] Можете в меня кидаться помидорами, но после десятка возвратов в одни и те же локации начало надоедать. Что уж говорить о том, если вы найдете все секреты игры.

[b]Звуковое оформление прилично[/b], звуки не режут слух, а музыкальная тема запоминается (Не 140, но все же).
Но то, что я не могу понять и простить - это случайное высказывание в репликах Шантае. Меня раздражало то, что она говорила определенные фразы время от времени. Если озвучивать, то озвучивать все, но так? Спорно, можете быть со мной не согласны...

[b]А что в итоге? В итоге приятный платформер[/b], который принесет вам море удовольствия от процесса, так и от некоторых юморных моментов и сюжетного абсурда.
Также, я очень надеюсь на скорый выход [b]DLC[/b], которое будет про главного антагониста Шантае - Риски...

Рекомендую к покупке как и любителям платформеров, так и обычному игроку с вопросом - "Во что бы поиграть?"
[b][u]Оценка игры: 9 из 10[/u][/b]

[spoiler]P.s. - Заставляю себя собрать все ачивки...)[/spoiler]

To start this off since the new update I wanted to say I loved this game even before Hardcore mode came out. I beat it on both normal and Hero mode. The level, item, character design are amazing. But now that Hardcore mode has come out it feels hard and I can actually die to minions now! Before Hardcore mode I only ever died to environmental hazards. I never died to Bosses either.

I never really do reviews but I feel like this game deserves it, because even if it was easy it was just that enjoyable. If you have never played the newest installment in the series and are thinking of buying it. Definitely! But if you do and want an actual challenge then go for Hardcore mode right off the bat. I'm not sure if you can go for Hardcore mode right off the bat without beating it once but I really hope you can.

30336411.review:
The worst of the three modern Shantae games - by FAR. Please hear me out.

The game is way too easy. You quickly become ridiculously overpowered. After less than half through the game I didn't even care about taking damage. You practically never run out of hearts, and if you happen to be close to death you have lots of potions, magic, pickups, and food to restore health. You can turn off the upgrades that you've acquired, but that should NEVER be required to make the game sufficiently challenging. Really bad game design.

[b]Edit: People are talking about a hardcore mode. But that doesn't justify that the "normal" mode feels like beginner difficulty, especially since the previous games were really hard in their normal mode.[/b]

The story is very forgettable. The plot progression is very often ridiculous, as the developers couldn't come up with believable ways to acquire key items. It just feels very rushed.

The humor isn't at as funny as it was in previous games.

Way too many transformations. Some of them are really boring, and some of them are almost never used apart from that one single stage you acquired them at.

The charming pixel art is gone. It was one of the things that made the Shantae series stand apart from other platformer games, but now even that is gone.

Not really the hardcore metroidvania style from the previous games. Really easy to acess the hidden areas.

Very easy boss fights. Very easy platforming. No charming characters. The game is very short.

Really bland game. Wish I hadn't bought it.
3/10
