30298936.review:
지니와 인간의 피가 반씩 섞인 반인반지니 미소녀, 샨태의 모험!

최고의 지니 미소녀 샨태를 조종해 리스키의 음모를 막고 마을을 지켜나간다. 비단 같은 머릿결로 괴물들을 사정없이 난도질하는 것도 여전하고, 특유의 밸리 댄스 역시 죽지 않았다. 최초로 HD로 나온 샨태인데 그래픽도 보다 깔끔해졌다. (이전에 비해 보다 애니메이션에 가까워진 기분이다.) 기존의 샨태 시리즈의 명맥을 잘 이어나가는 모습. 다만 메트로배니아의 양상을 띄던 전작들과는 다르게, 이번 작품은 확실히 록맨 쪽에 좀 더 강하다. 액션 쪽에 더 무게가 잡힌 모습.

지니의 피가 흐르는 그녀답게 다양한 것들도 변신한다. (사실 이건 샨태의 가장 중요한 아이덴티티이기도 하고) 각기 특성이 전부 다르고 최소한 줄거리를 진행하며 얻는 변신들은 뭐 하나 버릴 데 없이 전부 나름의 용도가 존재한다. 변신을 통해 게임을 진행한다는 컨셉도 참신하고, 그걸 게임플레이에 적당히 잘 녹여냈다. 다만 나중에 가서 변신을 자주 해야할 때가 있는데, 이 땐 게임의 흐름이 끊기는 감이 없잖아 있다.

기본적으로 꽤나 쉬운 게임이다. 어지간하면 별로 죽을 일도 없고, 무난하다 못해 조금은 심심하게까지 느껴질 정도로 쉽다. 팀 한글화의 궤적 덕분에 한글화도 아주 잘 되어있기 때문에 대사만 잘 보고 마을 사람들이랑 대화 잘 나누다보면 (아니면 아예 목욕탕 언니랑 친하게 지내도 좋다.) 뭐 할 지 몰라서 헤멜 일은 전혀 없다. 일부 수집 아이템이나 후반부 보스들이 조금 까다롭겠지만, 이 역시도 아주 우습게 깰 수 있는 방법이 존재한다.

확실히 컨텐츠가 좀 부족하긴 하다. 꾸준히 지목되던 점이라 도대체 얼마나 부족한가 싶었는데, 인디 게임이란 걸 감안하더라도 조금 부족한 감이 있긴 하다. 게다가 게임 자체도 꽤나 쉬운 편이라 작정하고 달리면 4-5시간 선에서 엔딩을 볼 수 있을 정도. 수집 요소 같은 게 나름 잘 되어있는 편이긴 한데, 워낙 갈 곳이 많지 않고 아이템들 숨겨진 위치도 뻔하다보니 100% 달성하는 것 역시 쉬운 편이다.

이걸 보완하려고 한건지 스피드런 도전과제가 존재한다. 제한시간이 3시간(100% 클리어의 경우 3시간 반)이라 조금 빡세게 느껴질 수도 있겠지만, 충분히 대비한다면 아주 못할 정도는 아니다. 추후에 하드코어 모드나 다른 캐릭터로 플레이하는 모드 등을 추가할 예정이라는데, 언제 추가될 지 아직 기약이 없다. 아무튼 인디 게임인 걸 감안해도 컨텐츠의 부족은 아쉽게 느껴진다.

리스키의 복수 때도 그랬다만, 이번 하프-지니 역시 아주 완벽한 게임은 못 된다. 그럼에도 불구하고 충분히 재밌게 즐겼던 게임이고, 그만큼 좋은 점수를 줄 수 있는 게임이다. 그리고 언제나 그렇듯, 샨태는 정말 귀엽고 말이다.

30203485.review:
Once again WayForward have delivered a wonderful adventure. Though different in structure, Half-Genie Hero retains its predecessors' exploration-heavy gameplay, encouraging players to revisit and eke out every secret from its varied levels. The move to hand-drawn HD visuals worried me at first glance, but in motion it's utterly charming and the attention to detail is excellent. Music maintains the very high standard of the series, and our lovable cast of heroes and rogues drive the lighthearted story full steam ahead.

Though not a challenging game by any means, Half-Genie Hero keeps the player on their toes with its abundance of secrets and a dash of precision platforming. The highest recommendation.

30184468.review:
The fourth game in the Shantae series is another instant classic. While not quite as good as Pirate's Curse, it offers snappy controls, plenty of movement and combat options, and a solid (if episodic) storyline with the series' trademark adorable pitch-dark humor.

Shantae herself controls as wonderfully as always. Once again possessed of her genie powers, she learns transformations from each stage or from hidden items. Most of them, such as the elephant (which can crush blocks) and the mermaid (which can swim freely underwater) are primarily movement-focused, and open up new areas of each stage.

Ah, yes ... stages. And therein lies the only problem with Shantae: Half-Genie Hero. In previous games of the series, Shantae would travel across the land, face a number of challenges, and then open up a dungeon for exploration. These dungeons were very much in the Metroidvania tradition, and navigating them successfully was the game's primary intellectual challenge.

In Half-Genie Hero, the dungeons have been removed entirely; at the point in each stage when you'd be unlocking them, you go directly to the boss fight instead. The stages are mostly slightly longer than before, but not really enough to make up for the loss. A couple of them -- Main Street and a late-game castle -- remain downright puny.

This makes the game's other negative more serious: the amount of BACKTRACKING. In the previous games, you mostly returned to old areas to seek out power-ups like life bar powerups or caches of treasure. While those are still here, some of the stages have little corners and nooks that contain MANDATORY items, including a transformation without which you can't even enter the last level! It honestly seems like you're intended to replay every stage to date whenever you get a new movement ability, or else take an amount of notes on obstacles that would put a JRPG to shame. (And even that wouldn't help in a couple of places -- I only found two crucial items by exhaustive searching.)

All of this shouldn't put you off the game, though. Shantae: Half-Genie Hero is linear, sure, but you'll still get many hours of sweet gameplay for your admission fee. It's absolutely worth the price, even if it doesn't quite live up to its immediate predecessor.

30180765.review:
So this is my third time reviewing this game. This update includes the DLC Risky Mode and Firends Forever.
Pros of Orginal:
Good music
Good graphics and animations
When there is voice acting it sounds good
Levels have many secrets
Gameplay wasn't too hard or easy (for the most part)
Smooth controls

Cons of Orginal:
Story is very lacking and feels rushed at points
Risky is pure evil despite what happened in the last game (Pirate's curse)
Levels were short and linear
Difficulty spikes because of different mechanics (such as the slide or using transformations for difficult sections)

Overal fixes:
Underwater mines now show explosion effect (No longer causing confusion)
Hypno Baron's castle can no longer be flown over at the outside area (at least in hardcore mode, not sure about orginal)
and some other small fixes I can't think of at the moment

Hardcore Pros:
Enemies are actually a threat and take more damage while doing more damage (although some enemies do way too much in my opinion)
Enemy attacks are faster and aim more for Shantae
Deserves the name "Hardcore mode" 

Hardcore Cons:
Enemy placement can feel just jerkish and annoying
The amount of enemies is way too high
Some enemies doing way too much damage for normal enemies
Bosses take too long at times or don't give you enough time to attack their weak points (Giga Mermaid is the worst in this case)
The first phase of the last boss has an instant kill attack (which is cheap not hard)
Risky takes even longer to defeat (doesn't help that if you die on the last boss you have to face her again)
The difficulty spikes from the orginal feel even worse and I hated them
It made this game a bad experiance for me (I loved the orginal story a lot and made me a Shantae fan but this made me feel like crap and I didn't enjoy playing it)

Overall I feel like people should play the orginal and should only play the hardcore if they're looking a for a big challenge, It's a shame that the hardcore mode changed my opnion of this game so much but it feels like it was made just to be hard, not to be fun or fair. I still like the game and I'm still looking forward to the other modes (like Risky mode or the other playable characters) but if they end up with that same difficulty I might take a pass. 
My scores of this game are 
Orginal : 78/100
Hardcore: 60/100

DLC Review

Risky Mode

Pros: 
Stages are made different and use Risky's skills to get through them. 
You can do any stage in any order, makes for replayabilty and a change of pace.
Risky is good to control and her abilites are fun and helpful.
Upgrades to abilities that make them more useful. 
Hard but fair.

Cons: 
Stages use the same music and have some of the same collectable locations.
The Kraken ball is useless to upgrade.
Too many buttons to press to do complex tricks needed to progress.
Some bosses like Giga Mermaid last too long.
Huge difficulty spike at the last level.

Friends to the end

Pros: 
Three unique characters to play.
Level up system is cool and easy to handle.
The stages are changed up again.
Retro music is used in stages that make the stages feel more unique to this dlc.
Each character is fun and easy to control.
Less button clutter.

Cons: 
Collectables are useless and just there for collection.
Bollo and Sky's dream magic abilites are almost useless.
There is no way to upgrade health or abilites making this debatably the hardest mode yet.
Bosses are very stressful as you only have three health.
Only one way to heal without finding hearts.

In the end I liked Shantae Half-Genie Hero. The DLC added to what I already loved about this game and the characters are all very likeable and funny. The graphics are top notch and gameplay is polished. The DLC didn't have any bullcrap moments like hardcore mode but Friends to the end definitely put me in the hot seat a lot. I'm a bit sad to say goodbye to the game but I'm glad I played it and don't regret my purchase.

Risky mode: 72/100
Friends to the end: 65/100

30112707.review:
I enjoy the Shantae Series, yet can't say this iteration is a step up. The only thing going for this game is the upgrade in graphics (Completely Objective) and that it continues the story for Shantae the character.

The story in this game was weak. It does however give a nod to what of the main characters mentioned before, and they did just that. ( Trying not to spoil the game here).

There are far more transformations in the games, which is nice. Say, we have 6 transformations in all, 3 would be base abilities, while the other 3 would be upgrades to those previous. Like a level 1 fireball that shoots 1 fireball to a level 2 fireball that shoots 2. Some transformations are oddly specific and have no other use to them.

Dances is what Shantae does, yet she does only one dance for all the transformations. Which was sad to see.... I liked where she had many dance moves (animations) when she would transform.

It seems art styles change with each game, and I am a huge fan of the Pirate Curse art the most. It had personality. I would blame transformations for taking up production time on making the conversation art better. 

Puzzles are nearly nonexistant, or way too easy. The game was fairly easy. I did not have to worry about dying due to lose of hearts, well, neither did I in the last game....

There is no map this time, and finding things was easy. Some items made the game too easy. You can turn them off if you think that would present a challenge. Then if thats the case, don't look for items.

Sadly, I would have rather played Pirates Curse again for the ingaging characters, side quests, and other such stuff.

The good part is that they made it easier for you to travel where you want faster with a travel dance and a whistle to travel from world to world. Save points arent the usual, where you find the guy and choose to save. Each section of a level requires you to make the choice. In case you die or are trying to do a certain achievement this shines. A Little.

I still recommend this game. I wished I got wind of the Kickstarter so I could support them. I want them to continue making more Shantae games, but I think they need to look back at Pirates Curse, which I think to be the best of the series.

Platforming is really weak. I'm not sure if this game was trying to cater to some group that thought the platforming wasn't important. They even threw in a small castle level with those detestable magic doors that warp you all around.

I feel the lack of funds and the over-ambition of making so many transformations has watered down the level design for puzzles and more animations for the characters has made this game not up to par.

30072730.review:
TL;DR: A wonderus harmony of what could well be some of the best platforming, exploration, and FUN I've ever had! I'm a gamer of over 25 years, and this game is simply AMAZING! New features: More direct level designs, a fresh "2.5D" graphics engine with HD support (4k+), AMAZING animation,  fun and memorable soundtrack you'll be humming all day long, and 10+ hours of gameplay. Super cute characters, PG-13 animated boobies on nearly everything, and nearly everything dances! Oh, and it's NOT a frustrating roguelike!


Long review:

Graphics: 10/10. Supports 4k+ resoutions. Beautifully animated (hand-drawn, not "flash game" type), "2.5D" graphics. Everything is bouncy, round, wiggly, jiggly, and FULL OF LIFE! Such talent and effort! Even the backgrounds are animated, every enemy, all the widgets, everything! If I could give an 11, I would! Thank you for raising the bar on what a modern platformer should look like!

Sound/music: 10/10. Beautiful, level-matching, custom soundtrack with loop points, an energetic song with vocals, fresh and original. A TON of effort was put into this soundtrack! Quality over quantity, every song is unique and very memorable! I LOVE THE SNARE IN MERMAID FALLS (a'la Sonic 2)!

Controls: 10/10. Accurate, precise, fast and responsive movements. Flawless and natural feeling with a gamepad! 

Gameplay: 10/10. Everything in the game "fits" and has a purpose. The level design is top-notch, reminiscent of games of old; nearly every level is like an onion, with multiple layers depending on your current abilities. They're not too mazey, not frustrating, yet they're challenging and clever. FUN BOSSES that aren't too frustrating or difficult! You never really get tired of revisitng a level and searching for treasures unfound. The only notch off a perfect score is the transformation selection system: it's NOT BAD, don't get me wrong, I didn't DISLIKE it, but it felt a bit out-of-place in this finely polished gem of a game. Noticeable when you need to change often in a level. I would have prefered a right-analog-stick menu, but I understand the choice that compromised between keyboard, non-stick gamepads, and xbox-style gamepads.

Story: 6/10. It's very fun and gives the game a way-better-than-most-platformers plot device. It's not going to bring you to tears or make you think about philosophy or anything beyond providing a fun plot device for the game to progress on. 

Game Length: 8/10. I got about 10 hours out of my first playthrough, and managed 92% item completion. At the end, I was hoping for one last uber-boss to appear, becasue that would've been perfect. I haven't played the other modes as of this review (2/20/17), but I'll give them a try and see how long I can actually stretch this game out to.

Overall: 9/10. Buy this game, it's EASILY worth $20. You'd be hard-pressed to get a meal for two for that amount, a couple coffees, or a boquet of flowers. The developers put thousands of hours (cumulative) into this game, requiring decades of talent and learning; and it shows BIG time! EXCELLENT JOB!

Final thoughts: I've been playing platformers hardcore since the early 90's. I like some platformers, and I dislike others. I like my platformers to be challenging yet fun (like Mario 3 or Sonic 2), or deep and immersive Metroidvania 40+ hour games. This game filled my "challenging yet fun" bucket FULL of candy!  I dislike games like Megaman, I Wanna Be the Guy, or most "that's a game mechanic, not a glitch" type games.

I thoroughly enjoyed this game. Everything about it is fun, detailed and engaging. I love the new engine, and the animations stand out in the best way possible. I like the "like an onion" level designs, and I wish every level had the same depth that Mermaid Falls had, even if it were for some pointless loot and a completion percentage. I wanted to use the mouse (transformation) and spider a little more! I REALLY like how the levels are shorter, much less mazey, and don't require a minimap to navigate. Thanks for an immediately amazing, thoroughly fun and extremely well-produced game!

29810791.review:
Shantae: Half-Genie Hero is an indie 2D Metroidvania platformer and the fourth installment in the series.

HGH boasts an enormous visual upgrade compared to its handheld predecessors, with smooth, fluid sprites popping against gorgeous 3D backgrounds. The sprites are lovingly animated and move with a bubbling energy, often, seemingly, in rhythm with the background music.  The game is a joy to the eyes and the ears, with an aesthetic integrity that's rare in indie titles.

These visuals compliment the story and characters of HGH. Shantae is surrounded by barely threatening antagonists and frequently obstructive friends, all of whom are charming and fun. Lacking a central antagonist for much of the narrative, the game is presented as a series of tangential episodes strung together by a vague goal, an undefined threat, and a series of humorous contrivances. As refreshing as this approach is, it often makes the game feel directionless. Further, whereas the previous installment gave Shantae a foil in the form of Risky Boots, HGH only casually touches upon the protagonist's relationship with her friends and enemies, making her feel unmoored in the setting.

As a platformer HGH gives a solid performance. Shantae controls with precision and grace in a world that makes her limitations clear; players won't struggle against false impressions of what obstacles Shantae is and isn't capable of surmounting. Puzzles are solved by transforming into various animal and monster shapes that are unlocked over the course of the game, most often at the expense of offensive capabilities. Combat is a fairly bare-bones affair, with Shantae being limited to a melee attack that's supplemented by underwhelming mana-dependent spells.

HGH is paced like a mad dash, with the game throwing power-ups and new abilities at players faster than they can find a use for them. Indeed, Shantae has a wide assortment of tools with too few obstacles to apply them to, and many of her more interesting powers go underused or are rendered superfluous by later acquisitions. Complicating this problem is all the backtracking that's required of a Metroidvania title; revisiting the game's small handful of areas quickly feels like padding, and makes replaying from the beginning feel unlikely. On the other hand, the dizzying volume of options available to Shantae by the end of the game will undoubtedly delight many players; for all of its backtracking, the sense of progress and growth is palpable.

While not without its flaws, it's difficult to not recommend HGH. The game is clearly a labor of love, with an emphasis on color and energy that's uncommon in today's industry.

I got Shantae Half-Genie Hero as a friend's christmas gift, and needless to say I was really really happy. Not only because I got a gift from a friend, but also because I was really into getting this game. That turn out to be the best gift I received in years!

29724006.review:
Pros:
+Same characters, same world, but in beautiful 2.5D
+Fucking AMAZING music, Jake Kaufman does it again.
+Really great level design
+Transformations are really fun
+Monster girls

Neutral:
*It's definitely way easier than before (I put this as neutral because some people might want this) but I thought that it was a little saddening that there was a significant decrease in difficutly

Cons:
-It's a little short (I 100% it in 5 hours, less than half that what it took me in Pirate's Curse)
-Continuation of above: The levels are way smaller than in previous games. While the individual areas are bigger so there's less loading between screens there's less going on in each level.
-Some of the Transformations are poorly utlizied


I'd also like to add that the "true ending" you get by [spoiler]collecting the four clues to get the Polarizer[/spoiler] is kind of anti-climactic. It just ends and we don't see a final interaction between [spoiler]Shantae and Risky[/spoiler] but it's possible that this was intentional because we'll see more in the eventual DLC modes that are supposed to come 2017 and onwards.

Verdict:
While the game is great in it's own right and a good evolution for the series, I can't help but feel that it doesn't quite top Pirate's Curse which was a really amazing game. It's still a great game, solid 8.5 from me. If you like the series or like 2D platformers then play this game, it's fucking great.

Also, Neo Burning Town is the best version of Burning Town.

29634140.review:
Note: I backed this game on Kickstarter.

Shantae: Half-Genie Hero is very interesting platformer. Before playing Half-Genie Hero I have played Shantae: Risky's Revenge and Shantae and Pirate's Curse. 

Shantae: Half-Genie Hero is much easier than previous games. I think I died only once while playing the game. The problem is that you can easily get Shantae overpowered for each stage. You get plenty of extra health, you get different methods of healing and you can power-up Shantae really fast. Also for last stage and bosses in it, I was able to be literally invincible. In other games I was never so overpowered. Good thing is that it's possible to turn off upgrades, so even if you try getting 100% everything, you don't have to be overpowered.  I believe that by turning of some of the upgrades, game gets much more challenging.

I'm also little sad, how little some transformations and their skills are used in the game. Some transformations I only needed once or twice and some of their skills I never needed. On the other hand other transformations and their skills you need little too much. Also I used some transformations to skip platforming sections.

I really love the new visuals. Every character and stage were visually very beautiful.  I think this game has best soundtrack of the franchise so far. Jake Kaufman truly nailed it with the soundtrack.

Game has pretty nice and very funny story. There are lots of jokes with the characters. There's even some fourth wall breaks. It's not very long game, but that is good for me. I finished the story in 100% in 11 hours. After that you unlock a new mode, which I haven't at the time of writing this review.

Even though I citicised some aspects of the game, I still loved it. It might be little too easy, if you make it too easy, but it's still very fun. Bosses are clever, though little easy. It is fun game. I'm not sure, if I liked this game more than Pirate's Curse, but I would recommend playing this one first of the franchise.

29622944.review:
I have played other Shantae games and this is my fave. From its art style to its platforming, it just feels better over all then the previous entres. It is slightly less difficult but that is a strength in this case, as it makes the game more engaging without becomming overly frustrating.

Plus, everyone is so peky and dances all the time, it has such an energetic vibe to it.

Mnus some backtracking, I loved every bit of it.

If you miss platformers and want a game that remembers what fun feels like, this is a great option.

29617795.review:
[b] Target Audience: [/b] [I] Non-Difficult Platforming Fans, or Those who want an enjoyable, relaxing romp [/i]

[b] Summary: [/b]  
The 4th game in the Shantae series (the GBC game counts damn it), Wayforward put a bunch of emphasis in revamping the presentation this time around: and the change definitely works. While I still enjoyed the more classical pixel style of the older series, this new art style brings colors that jump off the screen, while still keeping the animation quality at the series high standards. And while the sound design does leave a bit to be desired, the music is fantastic as you would expect when Jake Kaufman is involved (Shovel Knight, Shantae series fame). This game is just a pleasure to look at, and the character design is probably the best it has ever been in the series.

The gameplay on the other hand has taken a step back. While the platforming is still enjoyable, its difficulty in combat has taken a step back from Pirate's Curse, as some of the returning transformations such as the monkey form make dodging enemies a breeze. The emphasis on movement over combat still shows off the smart level design Wayforward is known for. And the boss fights do bring it a bit more this time around, as they are better designed then in Pirate's Curse. But a lack of length in gameplay and just a overall lack of difficulty plagues the game a bit. 

Overall, the game still is an enjoyable romp that keeps with the Shantae style. If you've liked the previous games in the series, you'll love Half-Genie Hero. Just don't expect an evolution in the gameplay.


[b]Video Review: [/b]  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vgfpjp1KdYM

[u] Lists: [/u]
[b]Positives:[/b]
[list]
[*] The art work and presentation change is fantastic, as the new color and line work really bring Shantae and her dancing booty to life on the screen. 
[*] Good color choices as always: putting the foreground and the action elements with the stronger hues. 
[*] Music selection by Jake Kaufman is fantastic, appropriate for the levels in question. 
[*] Boss fights have definitely gone up a notch, as they felt like more of a test of my overall skills then previous games. Giga Mermaid fight was a prime example of a good difficulty: not too hard, but needing to take some skill in order to execute.
[*] Good humor as always from the writers of Wayforward. Some groan worthy puns as always, but it's the good kind of humor.
[*] Level Design great as always. Always good to go through the first time, but still fun to go through on the next few playthroughs. 
[*] Enemy variety is good. Good mix ups of melee versus range.
[*] Good difficulty for the casual player.
[*] Performance is flawless. 60 FPS with no drops.
[*] Character design elements are fantastic as always. Being able to recognize Shantae in her transformations is fantastic through the specific characteristics like her headband and her eyebrows.
[/list]

[b]Negatives:[/b]
[list]
[*] The gameplay's combat has taken a step backwards. A bit easier to deal with enemies, and the enemies just don't pose the challenge they did in Pirate's Curse.
[*] Was Hoping for more after beating the game. I know that more content with new characters is coming later, but I found myself disappointed.
[*] Sound Design does leave a little bit to be desired, as some sounds seems to be missing, while others don't make a lot of sense in the big picture. Squeaky sounds on grabbing metal rings for example. 
[*] Shorter then the last games, and to me it showed a bit. Just didn't have the same impact over the full game's length.
[*] The Genie sub-plot here doesn't work as well as other games plot lines. The thread connecting the various substories is missing, unlike in Pirate's Curse.
[*] Keyboard default configuration must have been done with someone with giant hands.
[*] Missing sound sliders.
[/list]

개성있는 캐릭터들과 유머스러운 다이얼로그들이 재밌었다. 진짜로 최고였다.
블러드스테인드랑 악마성 신작 소식을 기다리다 지쳐 있던 메트로베니아 빠돌이인 나에게 한줄기 빛을 내려준 게임.
불타는 마을에서 '악마성 드라큘라: 피의 론도'의 첫번째 스테이지를 회상하며 플레이하니 참 감미로웠다.
칭찬할 점들은... 제이크 커프만의 음악이 끝내주게 중독성있었다. 특히 첫 챕터에 크리스티나 비가 부른 메인 곡과 인어 폭포의 배경음... 아아 안잊혀진다.

또, 유저들 평을 보아 본작보다는 전작인 '샨테: 해적의 저주'가 더 메트로베니아성이 짖다고 하니 전작보다는 좋은 평을 주진 못할거같다... 아직 해보지는 않았지만.
하지만 리스키나 볼로, 스카이, 로티탑스같은 인물들이 플레이어블 캐릭터로 차기 DLC로 나온다고 하니 기대중.

29581250.review:
[h1]Shantae; A Great Game With Problems (NO SPOILERS) [/h1]

        As a New commer to the franchise, I found this to be a fun and interesting entry to the platforming genre. The game overall was a blast to play and I enjoyed almost every second of it..... almost all of it, dispite me enjoing this game a lot there are Two main problems with the game. Firstly, the difficulty is somewhat all over the place for example I found the game to be pretty easy till the last level where there was a huge spike in difficulty as to where the rest of the games platforming was simple to requiring a little bit of skill and finesse. Lastly, the game has some pretty bad glitches and game breaking exploits. the worst glitch I encountered was when I was about to finish the fourth level I missed a platform and died, when I respawned the game freaked out and I belive Shantae had  spawned out of the level then the game crashed; When the game was lanched again I had lost all my saved data. Besides that glitch there were a few minor ones like getting stuck in terrain and getting in to areas with no way to get out with out going to the level select screen. there is also a really bad exploit that lets you to unlock every spell and upgrade that is purchasable after you beat the second level. Other then those problems I loved the rest of the game Expecially the music. So If I had to rate this game out of ten, It would be a 7/10 overal a great game with a decent amount of problems.

29572419.review:
I enjoyed all previous Shantae titles, but have been signifigantly dissapointed by this entry. The artstyle and writing are top-notch but the difficulty is all over the place. My most notable gripe with it is that dying then reloading your last save does not restore Shantae's health at all. This become the most infuriating during a slide obstacle section in Mermaid Falls, where I ended up going into the section (and saving) with only 1HP making it so touching anything would kill me instantly. With no options to load previous saves, I was left with the option to try and finish it without taking any damage, or to restart my entire save file, and play through the first hour of the game again.

As of writing this I have died 45 times on that section (which is ridiculously long by the way) and have since dropped the game, and refunded it. If I had the option to start the stage from the beginning again so I could try to have more HP going into this, I'd likely keep playing because I could fix the problem, but I'm not interested in playing the entire beginning of the game again.

If you don't like difficulty and are going into this for it's witty narrative and colorfull artstyle, this game isn't for you.

29497588.review:
Pros:
-Stage music is incredibly catchy (like really good Sonic music catchy)
-Extremely smooth and satisfying controls and platforming experience
-Story and dialogue are cute and hilarious
-Voice acting is adorable
-Visuals are extremely sharp, animations are silky smooth

Cons:
-Boss battle music is the worst in the series
-The entire game is painfully easy, and disappointingly short (less than 5 hours to beat it, 8 hours to 100% it)
-Boss fights look pretty, but are poorly designed (nearly impossible to dodge many mechanics, but trivial to just ignore the damage / eat consumables and faceroll through them)
-A lot of the new content (kickstarter goals, I think) is inconsistent (a lot of the new transformations you get are borderline useless, and only exist to solve one or two specific puzzles)
-Plot continuity has been effectively discarded, for those that actually cared about it (it's a prequel/not prequel/reboot/not-reboot ????????)

Neutral:
-Character design is generally more cute, less sexualized

TLDR: If you like Shantae, you'll love this game. If you like platformers/metroidvanias/casual games, you'll almost certainly enjoy it a lot, but the price tag might be a bit high for the amount of content there is.

29497002.review:
I came into this game with low expectations. I really didn't like Risky's Revenge, and never played Pirate's Curse. I was prepared to walk into another boring backtracking marathon.
And then The title screen came up and I changed my mind. You can tell a game is going to be great when the freaking title screen makes you excited. I made a new file and holy shit everything just blew me away. The animations are so fluent, the graphics are amazing, it controls really well, and that was just from the intro section.

I soon got into the game, surprised to see it's really more of a metroidvania hybrid of sorts. There are metroidvania elements, but for the most part it plays like a regular platformer. It's like your first time through the stage is normal, and once you clear it you can revisit it to get the stuff you couldn't before. Unlike in RR, the areas are all REALLY interesting. (Mermaid Falls is easily my favorite level in any platformer, actually!) And the backtracking doesn't get old. It'd be nice if there was a minimap of some sort, so you could easily check unexplored areas on the fly. But it's not that hard to figure out without it. I managed to 100% this game in 7 hours, and I enjoyed every minute of it.

A bit of a fair warning, though. This game suffers from "Help the enemy is too cute and I don't want to kill it" syndrome. Especially prevalent with Nagas, Mermaids, and Slimes. You may take lots of damage from ogling the things out for your head instead of fighting.

I don't usually mention music in my reviews, because there's not much to say about it usually, but this has a really great soundtrack. It's a real earworm that pumps you up. And what else could you ask for with a platformer?

The game isn't too challenging, as long as you keep yourself upgraded. If you get 99% before the last level, you are basically immortal, as you can infinitely use Invincibility or Total Restoration. And you'll NEED IT. Because WOW that last level is so freaking rough. It's incredibly challenging, much more than the rest of the game. But all that aside, the game is amazing in every other regard. I would easily say it's [b]My favorite platformer, ever.[/b]

[b]9.5/10. Go buy this game.[/b]

Controls are not good on keyboard with it restricting you to only using it, unable to bind functions to the mouse, even on non primary buttons. Overall was massively dissapointed on the continuation of one of my favorite games.

29489524.review:
Увидев среди новогодних подарков "Shantae Half-Genie Hero", я безумно обрадовался. 15-20 часов чистого наслаждения в компании с обалденным платформером обеспечены. Если судить по предыдущим частям, конечно, в которых единственным минусом был разве что навязчивый фан-сервис. Тем более, что это исправили, к тому же Шантэ перешла в HD-режим, графика сильно похорошела и стала похожа на Реймана, на что было очень и очень интересно взглянуть. Я не ошибся. Классическая метроидвения, красотой уступающая только "Ори", с музыкой, которую хочется скачать в плеер и слушать... нет, не просто слушать, жить ею весь день напролет, с идеально выверенным управлением, чудесным платформингом, системой первращений и заклинаний, магазинами и кучей секреток, искать которые настоящее удовольствие. Сюжет правда вновь нарезает круги по накатанному: долбанутый мэр опять увольняет Шантэ со службы в самый разгар событий. Кто-то похищает девушек и делает и них русалок, кто-то тырит ковры-самолеты прямо во время гонок, кто-то собрался призвать в мир Чудище Невыразимого Ужаса, а чокнутый дядя строит машину сомнительного назначения, даром что компоненты все опасные, но нам же важно "построить и включить, а там будь что будет". В общем, приключений предстоит целый воз и маленькая тележка. Хотя, в конце и этого мало.
Как водится, метроидвения про девчонку-полуджинна не ломает игроку хребет. Стоит прикупить в магазине все плюшки, порыскать немного в поисках сердец, и у нас уже имба-сборка, которую не так-то просто завалить. В конце вообще дают бесконечную магию и неуязвимость, что делает разборку с боссом до смешного легкой. Однако... чтобы дойти до босса, придется продраться через лабиринт ваншотящих двигающихся шипов, лавируя при этом словно бы сидя на летающем арбузе. Мата традиционное финальное  западло вызываем много, но и оно проходимо, надо только упереться рогом. 
Таким образом мы имеем обалденную игру, приятную в управлении, интересную в повествовании, смешную со своим юмором, красивую и положительную со всех сторон, и даже обладающую неким челленджем (попробуй найди все предметы и ключи от арт-галлереи, где куча забавных рисунков). Самое-самое, то, что дорогого стоит, это то, что можно просто взять в руки геймпад и без проблем окунуться в праздник жизни. Ведь подобная игра всегда праздник. 
Как думаете, рекомендую ли я Халф-Джинни Хиро? Всем любителям платформеров обязательно к прохождению.  Ret-2-go!

29486140.review:
Это третья часть серии платформеров Shantae. Я бы поставил её выше "простоватой" Risky revenge, но предыдущей игре серии (Pirates Curse) она, на мой взгляд, проигрывает.

Игра представляет собой типичную платформер метроидованию.

Из плюсов можно отметить похорошевшую графику. Разработчики отказались от псевдопиксельного стиля предыдущих частей и нарисовали приятную мультяшную картинку, что несомненно добавило яркости игре.

Неоднозначным моментом является сохраняющиеся из игры к игре каноны серии. Если с забавными персонажами мира  и их пропитаннным ненавязчивым юмором диалогами, действительно приятно встретится вновь. То цитирующие почти дословно предыдущие части декорации уровней и уже знакомые боссы несколько разочаровывают. В механнике тоже ничего нового, она перекочевала сюда прямо из Risky revenge и основана на типичного для жанра прыжкам по платформам, уничтожении противников и решении несложных головоломок путем перевоплощения в разных животных. 

Главным минусом, лично для меня, стала пониженная, в сравнение с предыдущими частями,  сложность. Не уровни, ни босы, ни квесты не вызвали каких-либо затруднений. При этом никакого хардкорного режима в игре не предусмотрено.

В целом игра несомненно должна понравиться любителям жанра.

Usually it's hard to amaze me when i try out new games and/or game franchises. But this game man... like holy shit, i didn't know what to expect. I've heard people complaining this game is short. I've gotta agree on that point but still, that didn't stop me. I've enjoyed every single second of playing this amazing game.
The soundtrack is so perfect, it can keep up with many Sonic Soundtracks in my opinion.
I love the artstyle. Strangely it doesn't look wrong with 3D backgrounds and 2D characters.
I'm suprised this game controls quite good on a keyboard, maybe has a little too many button maps but after a little work around it was completely fine for me though.
To the level design. It doesn't feature a large amount of levels, but every one of them is filled with hundreds of secrets.
You often have to revisit levels if you wanna go for 100% or need to get story-relevant stuff.
Over time you learn new so-called "Dances". By dancing you can transform into an animal and gain unique abilities like climbing, swimming, etc. to explore every single inch of these well designed levels.
The story is pretty simple but for a platformer its fine to my taste, i'm used to much worse stories in platformers. *Cough* Sonic Lost World *Cough*
The dialogues were exactly what i'm looking for from a platformer of this kind. Humorous but not over-exaggerated.
However, there's that one dude who kept fourth-wall joking like it was his job. I love him and the writer for that. xD

That's pretty much all i can say for now. i finished the game with 90% item completition in about 6 hours, i probably go for the 100%, which i rarely do by the way. ^^

I rate this game 9,5/10 You should definetely buy this game if you love platformers!

29454112.review:
This game is a worthy successor to Pirate's Curse. Everything about it is perfectly rounded and well finished.

The controls are tight, speedrun tight. Default button mapping is perfect with an xbox controller, and has rumble feedback

If you like visuals, you're in it for a treat: every sprite is beautifully hand drawm, and scenery is in 3D with plenty of details. The animations, as always a strong point of the Shantae series, are buttery smooth. Nearly every character and object in the game is carefully animated! This game really comes to life on screen. It was made for 1080p, but with anti-aliasing, plays at 1440p very well.

The soundtrack, again as is the case with previous installements of the series, is a gift for your eartubes! Lively bouncy catchy music will keep you immersed in Sequin Land for as long as you play, you might even want to spin the soundtrack every once in a while! It is THAT good.

As for the story i beleive that is where i will take off an egg; it is a shame they did not continue with the turn of events that were set up un the Pirate's Curse. In fact, i feel like the storyline did not get as much care as ther other aspects of the game. Quick point on dialog: humor? 4th barrier? Massive check!!

GamePlay wise, is is a traditional platformer with a twist: Shantae transforms into various creatures and you will need that power to get through, there are even mini-gauntlets targeted at some of those forms. It has some very imaginative platforming elements as well. Boss fights are super fun.

A personal note here, i found the game to be a bit too easy and a bit on the short side. BUT Wayforward are at work at the time of writing and there weresome neato DLC announcements. Too bad i missed the kickstarter.

29435109.review:
Half Genie Hero is another excellent Shantae game.  I've played Risky's Revenge and Pirate's Curse as well and each game has it's own strengths and weaknesses despite them being similar overall.  I've enjoyed my time with each game enough that I'm not sure I could even rank them. It should suffice to say that Half Genie hero was not a disappointment for me, but I can't say it stands head and shoulders above the other games either.

First up, the game looks fantastic, maybe not quite up to par with something like Ori and Blind Forest, but it has a crisp cartoon style that's appealing and is definitely one of the best (if not *the* best) implementations of 2D sprites on 3D backgrounds I've ever seen in terms of making the two look like they belong together.

The music is also great.  It conveys the feeling of upbeat chiptunes from platformers of old while still using a modern full (synthesized) orchestration.

The game is still basically a Metroidvania, just with discrete levels instead of a contiguous world.  The animal transformations (which weren't in Pirate's Curse) make a return and are a welcome sight.  The level of challenge is still pretty light, with the exception of two sections in the last level which can get a tad frustrating, but aren't too bad.

The one downside - the game is a little content light. There are only 5 main levels and then an ending level.  The game is structured so that you will need revist those 5 levels multiple times as you get new powers.  There's a scripted dependency where you'll get a power in one level that lets you explore a singe new area of another level, where you'll find an item which unlocks the next power in a different level and so on, at some point wrapping back around to letting you explore the next hidden area in the original level.  I.e. this isn't a game where playing through all the levels once gets you all the powers you need to unlock everything and then you can just go back to the levels one more time, getting all hidden items in one shot.

That said, the game is very generous at giving you tools to warp around levels quickly and you can quit out of a level as soon as you get an item or powerup without losing it.  So despite the need to revisit the same levels, they do actually allow you to eliminate much of the tedium of retreading old ground.

I was still quite satisfied with the amount of play time and the game overall for the price, but if there was just a little more unique meat on those bones, I think this would easily be the best Shantae game.

29432090.review:
les plus : 
- Graphismes : le jeu est vraiment beau, très détaillé, que ce soit au niveau décors ou personnages, c'est vraiment très agréable a regarder
- Animation : irrérpochable , aucun ralentissement (ce qui serait un comble pour un jeu en 2D)
- Musiques : Collent totalement à l'univers du jeu, mention spéciale pour la musique des boss, et celle du 1er stage lors du 1er passage
- Gameplay : Intuitif, simple
- Difficulté ; bien dosée, quoique qu'un peu facile tout de même, les rares fois où je suis mort ont été les chutes mortelles (qui sont relativement rares)
- Varieté des niveaux : Tous les niveaux sont bien différents des uns des autres, avec des phases de gameplay propre, c'est plûtot sympa 
- Combat de boss : Très variés les uns des autres, un très bon point.

Points neutres :
- Durée de vie : 8 heures pour le terminer à 100%, c'est ce à quoi je m'attendais, pas de surprises ni de décéption a ce niveau
- Transformations : Assez mitigé à ce niveau, les transformations ne se valent vraiment pas d'une à l'autre. Il y a les transformations " cheatées ", qui sont pour ma part le singe et la harpie, les "spécifiiques" (éléphant, chauve souris, crabe, sirène, souris), et "l'inutile", l'araignéé (dommage car elle pète la classe niveau design)
- les magies : même constat que les transformations, je n'ai utilisé (et très peu qui plus) que la magie cimeterre qui est bien cheatée je dois dire. Bouclier, jamais utilisé. Quand à feu et foudre, le seul intérêt que je leur ai trouvé et de garder Shantae en lévitation permanante, ce qui rend la dernière séquence de jeu trop facile.

Points négatifs :
- la "traduction" française : une catastrophe. entre les insultes qui n'ont rien à faire ici, mais surtout les NOMBREUSES fautes, c'est intolérable. Un "siffller"?? Franchement honteux.
- le backtracking : Etant donné que le jeu ne propose que 6 niveaux, que faire pour rallonger la durée de vie ? vous faire revenir 10 fois dans les 3 premiers bien sur (les autres, beaucoup moins). Au début ça passe mais c'est devient lassant de refaire le même niveau 10 fois juste pour aller récupérer un objet. J'aurais préferé avoir plus de niveaux, et moins de backtracking.


Au final dois-je recommander ce jeu?

Wunderschönes Spiel und tolle Animationen (der schönste Teil bis jetzt). Hätte ein richtig gutes Shantae Spiel werden können.

Wer die Serie kennt weiss was er bekommt und Hardcore SPiele waren es noch nie. Aber diesmal haben sie es einfach übertrieben.

Nichts an dem Spiel ist eine Herausforderung.
Es muss ja nicht jedes Spiel schwer sein, aber es sollte doch ein klein wenig Aufmerksamkeit notwendig sein um ein Level zu  bestehen.

Die Musik ist Shantae typisch und auch gut, aber Sprachausgabe gibt es so gut wie garnicht. Was mich jetzt nicht wirklich stört, nett wäre es natürlich gewesen. 
Sind nur ab und zu die ersten Sätze synchronisiert.

Being someone who is rather well acquainted with the Series The newest entry in to the Shantae series is a mixed bag for me because although the game does a Huge effort in making the transition from its art style personally it doesn't try to deviate from its main roots at all which in a given is not a bad thing.

My personal [+] about the game

The music as ever is so well tuned to meet the levels atmosphere.
The Shantae i grew up loving, with a wide range of character personality's and adventures to be had.
The presentation making itself well known from the jump of sprite animations.
Combat easy to Grasp and plenty to do clocking out the main story just under 7 hours.

Now the [-] about the game

The back Tracking of the Game is such a pain during the story as it always has you going back to the same world about 10 times in order to get set item to progress in one way or another and return to the main hub.
The Game's Hint system in the Spa doesn't help as its always saying things you may have already done.
A somewhat predictable ending to the story which i wish they had added some sort of twist to throw me off my scent.

In all though This game was pretty well recieved by me and Yes i would recommend it especially if you are a fan of the series or enjoy the games play style

29399216.review:
So much fun!

Not as much a Metroidvania as Pirate's Curse but still some of that element because of the way you unlock new animal forms. The forms give you the means to uncover secrets in previously completed levels.

[b]For those worried about length:[/b]

My first play through was around 12 hours because I took my time and collected everything and returned to levels multiple times. I could have done it faster but I was enjoying the game and I wasn't in a rush. I talked to every character I could, looked at all of the unlocked art in the gallery, etc.

My second play through I started in Hero mode with most of the animal forms unlocked and I completed the game in about 3 1/2 hours. I still went through and collected all of the items during this run so I could have done it faster but speed wasn't my goal.

Essentially, depending on what type of player you are, the game can be very short or plenty long.

I had a blast playing through it and even after two complete passes I'm contemplating a third run focused on speed.

[i]Highly recommended![/i]

29387953.review:
Virt hit it out of the park with this one! The soundtrack really holds the spirit of Shantae together in this game. Seriously the best thing of any Shantae game.

Music gushing aside, it's another fantastic Shantae game! Awesome, cartoony, and spirited graphics that define what goofy fun Shantae is all about. 

The [i]Pirate's Curse[/i] level select is back again. Personally, I preferred the persistant world of [i]Risky's Revenge[/i], but individual levels are easier to criticize while you play. They're always far more focused, just in the nature of their creation. Whichever you enjoy is your opinion, but know it's a level select like the previous game.

It's pretty much more of the same, finding goofy items for goofy purposes to further the story, with several unique, but repeated enemies. It saw the return of [spoiler]Squid Baron[/spoiler] as usual. 

[i]Significantly[/i] easier than the previous games. 100%ing before the final boss makes it absolutely trivial. This is remedied though: [spoiler]several bosses, including the final boss, have mechanical phases, instead of the usual hair whip spam, and the final boss is more acceptable because of this.[/spoiler]

All in all, I loved it. [i]Pirate's Curse[/i] was way better, but [i]1/2 Genie Hero[/i] is a very welcome addition to the series.

29376834.review:
I just wanted this game to END.

The latest Shantae is the 4th in the series and is a fully crowdfunded game.  The self destructive mayor fires  Shantae (again) and she must solve a series of problems and fetch quests to regain Scuttle Town's favor.

This game does a few new things.  First, the game is less like a metroidvania and more like Mega Man X.  The game no longer has a map, and instead has a sereis of levels with nooks and crannies that can only be accessed with new upgrades.

This game has the nicest production values of the franchise.  Characters are now fully 3d cel shaded, looking like Guilty Gear Xrd without the deliberate frame rate reduction, so all animations and movement are silky smooth.  The soundtrack is phenomenal, including electronic and funk beats.

The game starts off very strong, with wonderful humor, action and boss fights.  But as the game goes long, two things happen.  First, the action is bogged down between fetch quests.  For those who don't know, Shantae always has humorous fetch quests which depend on key items that you will not expect to need, recieve, or give.  In this game they are easily the most numerous.  You will run around in circles checking if your latest upgrade will work in "that one spot" you couldn't reach before.  If only you could remember where it was: you have no map!  Second, the difficulty of the game PLUMMETS.  This is easily the lowest difficulty game in the franchise.  In the time I spent running around in circles, I fully upgraded my attack and attack speed.  In the midgame, you will find heart containers like candy, to the point you can ignore enemies and damage to a silly degree.

This was the most tiresome and boring Shantae game I played.  Play Momodora or any other intense action game and just youtube the boss fights instead.

29370354.review:
I've been greatly enjoying some of the most recent WayForward games lately and this one is definately on the peak of enjoyment. Ever since they made A Boy and His Blob for the Wii, they have had this asthetic of hand drawn animations and amazing backdrops. I feel that Ducktales Remastered helped them solidify their style. And they brought it to Shantae, their own IP. And this game shines for so many reasons. Their art style brings every little detail to life. The music is really catchy, especially the one with lyrics you encounter early on. The gameplay gives this sense of exploration that fits the Metroidvania style of coming back to places once you have new powers. It is fun to play.

Now, there are a couple gripes I've got. The game length is pretty short. Getting near 100% took me just about 6 hours to do. If the game had maybe a level or two more, I'd feel more satisified. There is also a huge issue in Mermaid Falls in the factory setting. At one point, you are jumping from hook to hook, but they are not in sync to always line up. I've spent a great deal of time just trying to get up the first time I played. It was frustrating.

But beyond the slight flaws, I have to say I love this game. This is one I'd suggest you pick up and normal price if you love exploring based side-scrolling games. If you're on the fence, maybe wait for a sale, but I don't regret getting this game.

29366860.review:
I have been a fan of Shantae since Pirate's Curse, and Pirate's Curse is one of my favorite games of 2014. A new Shantae was very excited for me that the moment it went on sale and I had money I bought it and, long story short, I loved it. Now it's not as big as Pirate's Curse and 1/2 Genie Hero doesn't have dungeons like the last game but I still love 1/2 Genie Hero.
   Let us start with the graphics... amazing. No joke, this is what HD sprites should look like, not just high color pixels. What made me like the graphics especially was the fact that the character portraits look like the models. Pirate's Curse had portraits similar to this game but the sprites were pixels, it created a discord between what the gameplay says characters look like and what the portraits and promo art says the characters look like.
   The gameplay, on base level, is mostly the same as the previous game but with the added bonus of not having the well implemented pirate gear and replacing it with the well implemented animal transformations. The most useful to me was the monkey because of it's speed and jumping ability. Despite my previous statement on the animal transformations, there are many ways to cheat. Case in point, the bat. It is so easy and tempting to jump to the highest place on a horizontal scroll and transform into the bat and fly over every thing. Also the Harpie kinda makes the monkey and bat useless.
   And now some quick thoughts on small points. The music is amazing in 1/2 Genie Hero, I recommend that you go get the soundtrack from Jake Kaufman's bandcamp page, seriously you don't have to play the game to like the soundtrack. Next, the story, it's okay. SomeCallMeJohnny put it best, it's more like a series of microstories with a big plot at the end.
  I hope you found this review helpful and be kind this is my first review. Thank You!

29366347.review:
Before going any further into this review, I must point out that besides maybe a few minutes of the Game Boy Color original, I had no experience with the Shantae series heading into Half-Genie Hero. I had heard some great things about the franchise, I just hadn't gotten around to it until now. And let me just say, this game has made me very interested in playing the others.
Right off the bat, the visuals in this game are absolutely gorgeous. When it comes to side scrollers, a 2D traditional animation style is my preferred choice. The game looks so alive and vibrant, and the 3D environments only serve to compliment the 2D sprites. Most of the characters also have fun and cute designs, so there's no complaints in the visual department from me.
The sound is also awesome, this game has one of the more rocking soundtracks I've heard in a platformer in quite a while. I was tapping my foot throughout it. The minimal amount of voice acting sounds great as well, although it is underused.
The control is spot on, Shantae moves perfectly with your imput and it delivers a smooth platforming experience.
As for the gameplay itself, it's quite solid. I love games that give us the ability to switch out character styles at a moment's notice, and Half-Genie Hero allows for a number of fun interchangeable forms to help further are exploration experience. It was always exciting getting a new ability to see how it would change the level, and overall they didn't dissapoint. I will admit that while cool, I do wish the air transformations didn't somewhat break certain platforming segments once you obtained them.
The only two complaints I really have about this game is the length and backtracking. The game only has a few levels, which was a bit dissapointing since I liked all of the ones offered. Also the game features some serious padding with having us have to revisit levels with our new abilities. While discovering new hidden areas with new spells is a good feeling, it ends up with us having to play a lot of sections multiple times with little new content. Although they at least didn't make us refight the bosses.
Overall I really enjoyed this game, it is a very solid entry to the platforming genre. Without experience with the series prior, I'm not exactly sure how much this one innovated it, however the current foundation is solid regardless. I recommend this game to sidescroller fans who aren't turned off by having to revisit areas or a fairly forgiving game challenge wise.

29356670.review:
ＰＶを見て興味があるなら無条件にお勧め　とは言えない。

かわいいキャラクターがとてもよく動くのは、ゲーム初プレイ時には感動すら覚えてテンションが上がるが、２週目をプレイしたいかと言われたら、うん、お腹いっぱいかな　という気分になる。

全体的な難易度はそこまで高くはないものの、アクションゲームがさほど苦手では無い私でも、少しリトライを繰り返さないといけない様な場面が３～４箇所あり、アクションゲームが苦手な人には苦痛に感じると思う。

良い点と悪い点を併記しておきますので、許容できると感じる様ならお勧めできます。


良い点
時々若干の違和感を覚えるものの、日本語に対応してくれているのは非常にありがたい。

かわいいキャラクターがよく動き、新しいダンスを覚える度にどんな姿になるのだろうとワクワクする。

ちょっと空中で動けすぎる感じはあるが、操作性は良い。

回復アイテムがショップで買えたり、敵からのドロップなど入手ルートが多く、ダメージの回復手段が多い。

残機制では無いので、崖から落ちたりしても回復アイテムが尽きない限りはゲームオーバーにならない。

ゲーム内にギャラリーがあり、設定資料などを見ることができるのはうれしい。


悪い点
ダンスによる変身で新しいアクションを使い探索　と思わせておいて、進んだら小部屋が１つあるだけ　な場所が多すぎるのはガッカリ。
見えてるのに、その時点ではいけない場所が多いのも個人的にはマイナスポイント。

最初のステージの海に落ちたらミスになるのか初見ではわからず、一瞬飛び込むのを躊躇ったり、ファクトリーの輪っかに掴まることができるかがわかりづらかったりで不親切な点が多少気になった。

中央にボスが居て、ドーナツ状の地形を回るタイプのボス戦は、左右に移動すると攻撃の軌道もそれにつられて変化する避けづらい仕様なのは非常にストレス。
特に上下に弾むギアを落としてくる奴は、右から左へと弾んできたギアをくぐって回避しようとすると、キャラが右に進むと左への勢いが落ちて、キャラが左に進むと左へ加速する理解不能さ。

ダンスでクリアしたステージをスキップできるのは便利だが、１つ目のステージの最後の場所に用事があるときなどに２つ目のステージから戻ることができないのは少し不満。

魔力ゲージを消費するのに、魔法の効果が基本的に微妙でバリア系以外にあまり使いどころが無いのは少し残念。
火力アップに使えるパイクボール系はやや使える場面はある。

ゲームモードが３つあり、通常のモード、強くてニューゲーム（ダンスの一部のみ引継ぎ）、最後の１つは２０１７年１月１９日現在ではプレイ不可能。

初見殺し満載の落ちたらスタート地点から　な　オートスクロール急流下り（？）と、砂漠の下から巨大な虫に追われるステージは絶対に許さない。絶対にだ。

29350926.review:
Начнем с того, что игра замечательная. Прошел за пару деньков, очень увлеченно! 
Итак, сразу к впечатлениям: 

Игра очень качественная. Музыка, задники, анимация персонажей, геймплей - всё это выполнено на очень высоком уровне. В Shantae: Half-Genie hero приятно играть. Вот только, не смотря на всё это, явные недостатки имеются, увы. 

Здесь встречается редкий пример, когда качества игры недостаточно для того, чтобы она воспринималась полноценно. 
Всё время, проведенное в игре, я заметил одну интересную вещь: 

- События сюжета очень спешат и настолько сумбурные, что просто не поспеваешь проникнуться персонажами. Более того, сюжет местами просто не имеет связи с общим происходящим! Помните мультсериалы девяностых годов, вроде черепашек ниндзя? Когда в каждой серии происходило что-то новое, а основной сюжет отсутствовал вообще... Так вот, тут почти то же самое, только с притянутым за уши основным сюжетом. :) 

- Уровни слишком короткие. Они красивые, играбельные и приятные, с отличным саунтреком, но слишком маленькие чтобы насладиться ими в полной мере. И вот таких небольших уровней в игре всего 5. Казалось бы, при таком раскладе игру можно пройти всего за час, но нет. Вы потратите примерно 7-10 часов на прохождение всей сюжетной линии. Потому что Вам то и дело придется возвращаться в эти небольшие локации и искать различные секреты, которые помогут вам в прохождении игры. Пять наикрасивейших игровых локаций, но слишком маленьких при этом. Эх... Больше времени уходит не на их прохождение, а на квестовую часть с загадками и секретами. 

- От последнего уровня почти не получил удовольствия. Он красивый, но в плане геймплея просто ужасен. Сумбурный набор препядствий без всякой логики. Геймдизайнер новичок? Последний босс - самый скучный босс за всю игру. 

В целом, от игры положительные впечатления, так как не смотря на все эти недостатки она получилась очень приятной и невероятно качественной!

Вывод: 
Игра содержит качественный контент, реально качественный. Но им не так воспользовались как хотелось бы.

29316824.review:
I played this game directly after playing Shantae and The Pirates Curse, which I absolutly Reccomend. Honestly, Half-Genie Hero, while visually pleasing and mechanically sound, is not at good. Don't get me wrong, still a good game that I feel is worth the price tag. It is simply that the game did not do what The Pirates Curse did for me. One of my favorite things is that even the hardest levels of the game aren't too frustrating and I found myself wanting to complete the level no matter what. However, my main issue with the game is level design. There are 2-3 levels set up around the idea of you dying a handful of times before you learn the 'pattern' and make it to the goal. Unlike Pirates Curse, where the game would introduce you to new things individually before forcing you to deal with combinations, they made sure you had an idea of what you might be facing and then if you died, it was your fault because you didn't handle a puzzle or scenario correctly. This game makes the mistake of just throwing things at you and forcing you to find the best way while dying several times to do so. The other issue I have with level design is that the game has several animal forms that are essentally the same form just one of them is superior and the other one is required for one or two puzzles. For example, there are two water forms, one is large and lets you swim in any direction, the other is small and lets you walk under water. It can be said, oh you need the small form to get through the blocks of seaweed, but the large form gets an ability that lets it break through large blocks of stone, so the same puzzles for the small form could have been scaled to allow the large form in with the block breaking ability. Similarly you get two flying abilities, one that lets you fly left to right, and one that lets you fly freely, the left to right one also gets another ability that is only usefully for a single puzzle and most of the left to right flying power's puzzles could have been solved by the free flying one if they had simply changed the distance of spike walls or removed one entirely, the left to right form cannot go up or down, so you simply transform on a platform and float lazily left or right. My final two issues are with post game events. During the entire game you can travel back to each location with the boss fights and some hazards removed, ie. sand storms. Yet for some reason they give the option to start a new playthrough with all of the main transformations already unlocked, it seems pointless seeing as aside from the end game boss all the bosses were beaten without using transformations. The final issue is simply a continuity problem in my opinion that involves spoilers, but as you can guess from the title, Pirate's Curse, the previous game was about Shantae and Risky Boots.

****Spoilers Below****

At the end of Pirate's Curse they show not only does Risky Boots reguard Shantae as some semblance of a friend, but she is extremely smart and was able to plan the entire adventure ahead insuring Shantae's Victory. So why in this game is she so dumb she not only drops a map to her hide out, but several articles of clothing around town? The other issue is that at the end of Pirate's Curse the two part ways, Shantae returning to being the Guardian Genie and Risky saying she must forge her own path, as she cannot become a 'goody two shoes' like Shantae, they part with a seeminly mutual understanding and a few nice words that make Risky seem like she actually has grown to like Shantae as the adventure came to a conclusion. So why would Risky just leave a Shantae after she converts her magic to dark magic, wouldn't she want to take her friend with her? Which reminds me, when Shantae is converted to evil nothing happens, literally each of her friends says, hey snap out of it, and she does. It's very anticlimatic and it feels like a small mini-boss fight is missing.

If you actually read to the end, I'm amazed I know I went off on a tangent, but over all the game is good and a worth while buy, it just doesn't stack up to the standard that the previous game set for me.

My only complaints about the game is how horrendously easy and exploitable it is. Two hours in I found an exploit for infinite currency. Aside from that, there are items in the game that make your effective health absolutely unbelievable. This shouldn't talk you out of the game though, I still had a great time even if everything was easy.

29286796.review:
*Note: I was a backer for this game*

This latest installment is a bit of a departure from the rest of the series, but is fun nonetheless.  For those of you that are new to the series, this game is made up of 18 well-designed levels (3 levels per world, 6 worlds total).  There are 8 creatures you can transform into to aid in traversal, but some of them are redundant (do we really need 2 forms for flying, and 2 for swimming?  Surely these could have been merged).  Where the level design differs from past games is that they are more linear like you would find in a standard 2-D platformer.  This is a good or bad thing, depending on your preference.

Cons - The game is pretty easy, with up to 10 heart containers to find in the world, buyable armor that you can get very early to cut damage recieved in half, and a bat form that can also be found pretty early that breaks most of the platforming sections after that point (if you really want to cheat).  Bosses can be fun when trying to work out how to damage them, but with lots of health, armor, and recovery items you rarely need to even bother with dodging their attacks.

The story seems to be decently written, and funny at times, but is also unfocused.  Each level is treated like it's own episode, which sounds nice, but also means that things are introduced and quickly discarded.  For example a rival Half-Genie Holly appears after the first level, but disappears after some taunting.  After the next level, she appears in 2 more scenes before she's gone for good.

The game is really short.  My first blind playthrough of this game took about 7 hours to get to 100% completion.  When hunting for trophies on the PS Vita version I finished the main campain in 1 hour 40 minutes (any %) and 3 hours 30 minutes (100%).  More content is on the way as DLC, and it'll be free for me, since I'm a backer, but others will have to pay for it.

Pros - The game is beatiful, with great music.  It is made up of 2-D characters on 3-D background, but at times it hard to tell what's drawn or not.  The style blends very well.  Animations are smooth (though maybe the idle animations can be a bit over-blown sometimes).  I've enjoyed Jake "virt" Kauffman's music since the VGMix days, and this soundtrack is no exception.

The levels are fun when you don't break them with Bat or Harpy form.  Playing with minimal power-ups feels like a closer approximation of the intended experience.  Level and monster designs are good when the skillset is brought more in line with normal 2-D platformers.

Searching for secrets in this game was a lot of fun as well.  The developers put in some interesting puzzles, making re-visiting levels something you actually want to do.

Rotty Tops.

As for a straight "Recommend" or not I'm a bit torn.  I honestly had a lot of fun playing through the game, but at $19.99 USD for what is a 4 - 8 hour game it might not be worth it.  I will click "Recommend" for now, but I would advise that maybe you wait for either a sale or at least for some of the DLC to come out.

29286232.review: O jogo é mais fácil que seus antecessores, o que não deixa de ser excelente.

29285265.review:
I absolutely adore this game! The aesthetic is gorgeous, colorful and vibrant, with a range of interesting and distinctive locales. The character designs are absolutely top notch and a treat for the eyes, whether they be cute, sexy or both, not to mention that they are animated so fluidly and gracefully. Truly a triumph!

The story, while simple and following the usual tropes of platformers, did through me for a loop and there were genuine surprises and unexpected turns. Even then, the formula is not so much that this game is unoriginal in its approach and more about not fixing what isn't broken.

This game is such a treat to play. It controls well, and the unique mechanics such as the dancing to change to different character modes to the use of magic abilities was intuitive and easy to grasp while providing a surprising amount of depth, offering multiple avenues to approach the game. Not to mention the difficulty. True, it isn't Nintendo hard, but it is certainly challenging without being frustrating, for all players of all skill levels.

An absolute triumph. I recommend this game to anyone with even a passing interest in 2D platformers.

29279319.review:
Note: Playtime isn't displayed correctly, because I've played on a different system for the most part. Actual total playtime is just shy of 10 hours as of now.
------------------------------

Shantae: Half-Genie Hero is a short but very sweet platformer with some nicely integrated Metroidvania elements and interesting character upgrades and skills. 

Level design is very good for the most part of the game, the soundtrack features some very nicely remixed versions from some of the previous games and is generally fitting for the fast-paced style of the game. 

Character design is especially nice, with some pretty funny and light-hearted dialogues, deceptively cute drawings and brilliant animations. Just seeing the characters bob to the beat of the rhythm is truly heartwarming.

The platforming itself feels good and responsive at all times and integrates the skills the game has to offer nicely.

The difficulty starts off a tad on the challenging side, but actually gets progressively easier as Shantae gets more upgrades, up to the point where she's outright overpowered and some skills that pretty much break the game (talkin' about you, secret-key-bonus. ;P). Thankfully all the upgrades are fully optional and can be switched off in the menu at all times. Some transformations make platforming in some levels a little too easy in my opinion though.

It took me almost 10 hours for 100% completion, but I took it pretty slowly. If you know what you're doing you can certainly beat it much faster. The game does offer a certain replay value, although it might not be enough for everyone to make them want to replay right away.

The only real downside is that, compared to it's predecessor "Shantae and the Pirate's Curse", Half-Genie Hero feels a little more shallow, with less dialogues and a little less of the series' refreshing whacky humor. And even though most of the levels are extremely well designed, I really miss the dungeons of the previous game that had to be beaten at the end of a level.

Still, if you're looking for a light-hearted, nicely paced platformer, I'd say you can't really go wrong here for the ~20€ this game costs. I for my part have had a lot of fun with this and will certainly keep a eye out for possible DLCs or additional content.

You've made it this far. Thanks for reading my review. ;)

After about 8 hours of the game i knew this was a definitive good choice.The levels are all fun (even if a little challenging) with great sound and good graphics taking you on a silly adventure to save the genies however all these good things are ruined by two things. The last two levels. After such a magical adventure you would expect to have a challenging way to show your mastery of each form you've used before extensively. However the last two stages are tainted by some of the worst level design I've ever seen. After six level of megaman/metroid style game play these last two stages just focus on two broken mechanics to make a level so hard I died more than i did in the first six levels. In fact I counted, I died 3 time through the WHOLE game until the last stage. Depuis que j'ai regardé des extraits des magazines de Nintendo Power, Shantae m'a inspiré très facilement! Comme j'aime les personnages qui ont la puissance de transformation (comme Kirby par exemple), Wayforward m'a donné l'envie d'acheter le jeu! Une fois dans la main, j'ai rapidement aimé la personnalité de Shantae et son univers! Pour un jeu comme celui-ci, j'ai eu beaucoup de plaisir à jouer le jeu jusqu'à 100%! Toujours BRAVO pour Jake Kaufman pour la musique épique.

Les personnages secondaires ont tous de bons intérêts personnels et une bonne personnalité dans leurs rôles (Surtout mon préféré est "Sky"). L'histoire est très drôle et des scènes originales qui m'ont marqué. Mana et objets passifs sont variés et plus lumineux à chaque fois. Fondamentalement ... Je recommande ce jeu très possitive parce qu'il est très bon et bon contenu.


AVERTISSEMENT: Le paragraphe suivant contient Spoil sur le jeu. Si vous n'avez pas terminé le jeu entier, ne perdez pas votre plaisir.

J'ai vu quelques erreurs sur le jeu et je veux les mentionner:
* Il ya des erreurs dans les mots qui vous empêchent de lire les phrases.
* Vous ne pouvez pas retrouver votre vie et mana au maximum après le "Game Over".
* La façon de gagner des transformations n'est pas vraiment logique (trouver une transformation dans un coffre-fort)
* Le seul Shantae sans donjon. Mais je crois savoir pourquoi.
* Grunts Technos sont les seuls ennemis mal travaillés du jeu (Quand l'ennemi est sous observation et vous êtes derrière lui, il peut vous détecter sans vous regarder, ou quand vous vous laissez toucher par l'ennemi jusqu'à ce qu'il reste fixe et tourne Dans toutes les directions en mini secondes).
* Quand vous parlez d'une forme quasi-translucide, vous devez parler d'une forme particulière qu'il fait l'action (je me suis ennuyé pendant 10 minutes pour comprendre -_- ').

Cela vous apprendra de vos erreurs cachées pour ce jeu. Mais vous avez bien joué pour votre nouveau succès!

29266984.review:
It's worth noting that this game is not really a metroidvania, anymore, like previous installments. There are some pros and cons to this format, though. It's much more linear, employing stages rather than a single world for you to explore. I think this helps the player progress through the game more quickly keeping the fun alive rather than feeling like you you're constantly just running around on the map to find things like in previous titles. 

The game is gorgeous. It's is colorful, the characters are adorable, the levels are fun to run through, and the music for the game has some really nice arrangements of the main tunes from the franchise. I had doubts, initially, about the style of the game when I first saw it on Kick starter, but it's grown on me and now I really love it. There are lots of transformations -- perhaps too many as some become almost obsolete after getting new ones that replace them -- and open up possibilities for combat and exploration -- and they all looked great, as well. The transformations are pretty easy to utilize and don't really require specific button motions to transform like in the original. 


On the flipside, however, the game almost feels like it's not finished. There's a lot of polish to the game overall, but it just feels like it's too short or as if there are stages "missing", if you will. However, this may be remedied with the Risky Boots DLC in the future. 

Additionally, one complaint I have about the linear level design is that you have to go back to previous levels many times to get things that you get either later in the stage or in future stages and you can't go backwards inside of a stage. Basically, each stage is split into separate "divisions", where, once you go past one within the stage, you can't go back. If you need to get to an earlier point in the stage -- which is sometimes required because on more than one occasion, you get an item towards the end of a stage that you need for the beginning of a stage for a secret or item to progress further in the game -- you're going to have to go through the entire stage all over again to get to that part of the stage. This made the game feel artificially longer than it was. It almost felt like a weak supplement to the game to lengthen it. 

The last problem I had with it was that the characters aren't really developed that much in it. Pirates Curse had a LOT of character development in it. You learned a lot about Risky Boots and almost developed a friendship, almost, with her, by the end of the game. However, in this, it's as if it never happened. She's strictly the villain with seemingly no recollection of the events of the previous game. It's the same way with other characters, as well, like Rotty-Tops, for instance. You grew and learned a lot about her in Pirate's Curse, but in this, you really don't interact with her much. It's like once and that's pretty much it. Even less for Poe and Abner. You basically only say one thing to them at one point in the game and that's more or less the last you see of them. I really wish there had been more character development or some sort of additional focus on the characters than the game gave. It very much felt like a cycle of, 

1. Meet one character that needs item to get you to new stage
2. Go to stage to get item
3. Give item to new character
4. Gain access to new stage 
5. Next to nothing for interactions with that character for the rest of the game. 

and just repeat that for the rest of the game. It just kept the world feeling like it wasn't fully fleshed out when you didn't really interact much with all of the characters you got to know so well in Pirates Curse. 


Those are my only big complaints, however, and they're far out-weighed by all of the positives of the game. It's fun, it's colorful, and just a joy to play. Absolutely worth playing.

I never really knew about this game series, before the Kickstarter for this game kicked up a storm of fanart on the internet, I'd never even been much of a platformer fan... but...
Playing Shantae: Half Genie Hero, kinda feels like being a kid again, it feels like I'm an 8 year old me sitting on the floor in front of my Playstation with a new interesting game I'd gotten my parents to buy me at the mall.
I'd have sat in the car reading the manual booklet from cover to cover all the way home, and now I sit here with the game... and just the game.
There's no DLC, no micro-transactions, no gritty realism, no bullshit lies about your choices mattering, no tacked on multiplayer as an excuse for always online DRM.
Just the game.
Just a fun, silly, pun-filled and really well made game with a surprising amount of depth and challenge to it and a great soundtrack too.
I'm actually getting a little teary eyed sitting here thinking about why I like this game as much as I do.
Like I said, it kinda feels like I'm a kid again, and it feels fucking fantastic.
Thank you Wayforward.
